because come on -- the menu said shrimp and tomatoes and the salad had none of those things.
They just yelled at me some more and whatever, I would have been happy to tip them if they simply listened to my concern and did something, but I guess this isn't the type of place for that.
So, yeah --

I paid the bill and left all frustrated, but stumbled into a Buddhist temple down the street and did some meditation which brought perspective that my first world problems of a tea salad not having shrimp are not all that bad.
tea salad.author: Alex L.
tea salad.review:
I love Burmese food so I had to check this place out while I was in the Mission.Upon walking in, I noticed this place is literally just a counter.

As you sit down, you will likely be within spitting distance to the 'chef.' It's may also get really hot from all the cookin' and the fact that you're in a tiny, tiny space. Although they do get some points for having a place to hang your coat :), hey little things matter - right? I was taking a phone picture and got yelled at for it (I made sure no faces were in the picture), so eep! Watch out with your camera phones!

I ordered the Mango Chicken and a tea salad (both dishes were $6). The menu said the tea salad comes with dried shrimp and tomatoes so I was pretty excited -- I do love some shrimp and the concept of a salad from tea leaves is incredible, right? Well, the salad comes out and it's a few tea leaves with some dried beans.. no shrimp or tomatoes. I mentioned something and got yelled at that people didn't like the shrimp in the salad, so it no longer comes with it. Okay, that's cool, but it would be nice to be told this before I place the order..? I was disappointed.

The mango chicken on the other hand was incredible. Large portion, good amount of chicken, pieces of mango (I didn't even know mango could be cooked like that) and just typing about it makes me want to eat some RIGHT NOW. I tried to ask for a few bucks off the Tea Salad at the end, because come on -- the menu said shrimp and tomatoes and the salad had none of those things. They just yelled at me some more and whatever, I would have been happy to tip them if they simply listened to my concern and did something, but I guess this isn't the type of place for that. So, yeah -- I paid the bill and left all frustrated, but stumbled into a Buddhist temple down the street and did some meditation which brought perspective that my first world problems of a tea salad not having shrimp are not all that bad. :)

Anyway, come here for cheap food -- get take out if at all possible. The mango chicken IS incredibly delicious.

excerpts: See picture of tea salad in Togo container with regular mug next to it.
The container was barely half full.
Also try ordering the black bean sauce fish and you'd know.
It doesn't cost that much to add a little.
tea salad.author: Gus K.
tea salad.review: Yes, the food is good. But the portion size are so small that might as well be serving French dinning.  See picture of tea salad in Togo container with regular mug next to it.  The container was barely half full. Also try ordering the black bean sauce fish and you'd know.  It doesn't cost that much to add a little.

excerpts: I had the cold chicken noodle and the tea salad.
tea salad.author: Foodlover B.
tea salad.review:
I thought my food was great. 

It's pretty entertaining  to try to order, then wait and watch everyone try to order.. Don't try to tell them to make any changes to your order, the guy ahead of me was getting  yelled at for asking for more sauce in his noodles....my best advice is to come here with humor cause these ladies are  brusque!!!

I had the cold chicken noodle and the tea salad.

Walked here after class at Yoga For The People...

excerpts: Tea salad and chicken noodle soup both ridiculously good, and at about $7 each, what a deal.
I would eat here all the time if I lived nearby
tea salad.author: Brown S.
tea salad.review: Tea salad and chicken noodle soup both ridiculously good, and at about $7 each, what a deal.  I would eat here all the time if I lived nearby

excerpts: Food not so special, super greasy, only tea salad was good.
The ladies yell at customers for: taking pictures?
for seating down w/o your guest who is at a store around a corner getting cash???!?
It's no cool, unless you go to the special "rude" restaurant
After 15min you smell like an old pot of grease, that place has ZERO ventilation.
For the variety of foods and places SF has to offer I will pass on this next time in the area.
tea salad.author: Aleksandra I.
tea salad.review:
Hole in a wall, so you cannot expect much. Food not so special, super greasy, only tea salad was good. The ladies yell at customers for: taking pictures? for seating down w/o your guest who is at a store around a corner getting cash???!? It's no cool, unless you go to the special "rude" restaurant :) After 15min you smell like an old pot of grease, that place has ZERO ventilation. 
For the variety of foods and places SF has to offer I will pass on this next time in the area.

excerpts: Totally hole in a wall and tiny, delicious tea salad was an appetizer and a palate cleanser.
The popular noodles were wrapped with just enough amount of oil and the chicken was good crispy delicious.
tea salad.author: T L.
tea salad.review:
(See pics) Review #1131. More of 4.3 stars. What happened when you have a heavy breakfast and skipped lunch? You are on a carb starving mode and all you can dream (crave) of was greased up Chinese food.

Totally hole in a wall and tiny, delicious tea salad was an appetizer and a palate cleanser. The popular noodles were wrapped with just enough amount of oil and the chicken was good crispy delicious. And I did finish the whole bowl  (not huge) very quickly.

Definitely love the fresh coconut but felt sorry when they had to saw it through with a knife manually.

And it's quite inexpensive.

Also love this kind of atmosphere, hot, cozy, a sense of style and super friendly service by the super sweet Asian women and other patrons.

Ah yes, there's a line but it moves rather quickly (15-20 mins) for dinner.

excerpts: But I will never go back because they shrunk the tea salad to a couple tablespoonfuls and are rude.
The last two times I went in, there were 3 other people there because I know the good times to go and never wait in lines.
The main lady was on the phone and when she got off she proceeded to do everything else but acknowledge me.
I walked out both times.
No "I'll be with you in a minute.
No "hi".
Nothing.
Anyway, they don't wash they hands and the counters are filthy.
I'll get my Burmese across town at star or at Streat foods, thanks.
tea salad.author: Josie L.
tea salad.review: I've been a regular here for years, loving Burmese food, cheap prices, funky one counter holes in the wall and I live directly across the street. But I will never go back because they shrunk the tea salad to a couple tablespoonfuls and are rude. The last two times I went in, there were 3 other people there because I know the good times to go and never wait in lines. The main lady was on the phone and when she got off she proceeded to do everything else but acknowledge me. I walked out both times. No "I'll be with you in a minute." No "hi". Nothing. Anyway, they don't wash they hands and the counters are filthy. I'll get my Burmese across town at star or at Streat foods, thanks.

excerpts: I really enjoyed their tea salad.
Just the right amount of spice and very appetizing.
Their house noods are AMAZING.
We got 2 orders.
One beef and one pork.
We also got their curry chicken and mango chicken.
tea salad.author: Jennifer C.
tea salad.review:
CHEAP and DELICIOUS. Nothing here is over $6 and there is such a great variety to choose from. 

I really enjoyed their tea salad. Just the right amount of spice and very appetizing. Their house noods are AMAZING. We got 2 orders. One beef and one pork. We also got their curry chicken and mango chicken. Both were delicious with the rice they came with.

Potstickers were big and juicy. My first time trying samusas. Will definitely not be my last. So good.

Place is ideal for to-go/pick-up. I want to try everything on the menu.

excerpts: Tea Salad tea leaves, cabbage, fresh tomato, onion, dried shrimp & variety of fried bean, nuts and sesame seeds - $6 - I'm not sure why there was no tea leaves??
It was GOOD but not GREAT.
Yes all very fresh ingredients but wish there was more tea leaves to bring out that strong bitter tea leaf taste.
ah well...
tea salad.author: Sandy L.
tea salad.review:
The perfectooooo greasy spoon and Burmese/Chinese food at that! We got lucky and there were a few empty seats, Tues 11am...you're thinking lines on a Tuesday? Yup, this is the type of place that does! Seats about 10 on the bar stool so try to go on your off-hour or you could be waiting for a while.  The better alternative would to actually get the food TO GO to avoid the long line situation altogether!

Chicken Noodle Soup coconut noodle soup with chicken, onions, and cilantro - $6 -  I've had traditional Burmese chicken noodle soup and this comes pretty freakin close!  It's not the best I've had but when you don't have the time to prep the broth 24 hours in advance, this is a good alternative.  They cook to order and the broth is creamy and full, the noodles are cooked to order and they have nice full flavors of coconut, garlic, onions and cilantro.   

Tea Salad tea leaves, cabbage, fresh tomato, onion, dried shrimp & variety of fried bean, nuts and sesame seeds - $6 - I'm not sure why there was no tea leaves??  It was GOOD but not GREAT.  Yes all very fresh ingredients but wish there was more tea leaves to bring out that strong bitter tea leaf taste.  ah well...  maybe they should RENAME this item because if i didn't expect tea leaves i would say this is quite an excellent salad!

Yamo House Noodles mixed with fried garlic, and a choice of beef, chicken or pork - $6 - Greasy but so delightful!  Every bite is full of that garlic taste.  We got chicken and i absolutely LOVE the way that they prepare the chicken.  Crispy and crunchy on the outside and still juicy on the inside.  The noodles are the perfect amount of chewy and i really enjoy the sauce that they mix all together in this unique stir fry.  This is MY GO TO ITEM.  

Next time I think I might call ahead to order TO GO but this was a good experience sitting in this little piece of Mission district heaven.

excerpts: I had high expectations for Yamo given the glowing reviews and my own love for tea salad -- the tea salad was pretty OK for $6.25 (except there wasn't really any 'tea' in it) but the service was terrible.
Ordered a noodle soup specifically asking for no cilantro -- only to find cilantro in it and have the waitress/cook challenge me saying that it wasn't cilantro
(I've spent my entire life avoiding/detecting cilantro in many a dish
so I definitely knew what it was).

Instead of redoing the order (I hadn't even touched yet), she just started picking at it with the same chopsticks she had used for something else with impatience and annoyance written all over her face.
Hole in the wall or not, it was an experience that left much to be desired.
And especially when you're in the Mission, cheap, GOOD hole in the wall options are aplenty -- will not be coming back to this one unfortunately.
tea salad.author: wendy q.
tea salad.review: I'm all for hole in the wall places -- in fact, I LOVE hole in the walls but this place, unfortunately embodies all that is bad about one without the good -- dirty, grimy, and bad service.  I had high expectations for Yamo given the glowing reviews and my own love for tea salad -- the tea salad was pretty OK for $6.25 (except there wasn't really any 'tea' in it) but the service was terrible. Ordered a noodle soup specifically asking for no cilantro -- only to find cilantro in it and have the waitress/cook challenge me saying that it wasn't cilantro (I've spent my entire life avoiding/detecting cilantro in many a dish so I definitely knew what it was). Instead of redoing the order (I hadn't even touched yet), she just started picking at it with the same chopsticks she had used for something else with impatience and annoyance written all over her face. Hole in the wall or not, it was an experience that left much to be desired. And especially when you're in the Mission, cheap, GOOD hole in the wall options are aplenty -- will not be coming back to this one unfortunately.

excerpts: Tea salad. be appreciative, and don't let your tech privilege get in the way.
Go back to Mountain View.
tea salad.author: Troy R.
tea salad.review: The ladies may be a little mean. But, the food is so amazing that if you complain you suck. Mango chicken. Tea salad. be appreciative, and don't let your tech privilege get in the way. Go back to Mountain View.

excerpts: Tea Salad was the best
and we had great noodles too!
tea salad.author: Steve F.
tea salad.review: Just amazing Burmese food!  Tea Salad was the best and we had great noodles too!

excerpts: but WOW when I took my first bite into the tea salad.
After a few bites of WOW'ing and nodding, I asked... whaaaat is that crunchiness in every bite I take?!
tea salad.author: Kathy Y.
tea salad.review:
WOW. I had no words but WOW when I took my first bite into the tea salad. After a few bites of WOW'ing and nodding, I asked... whaaaat is that crunchiness in every bite I take?! (mystery yet to be discovered)

We also got the house noodle with beef. We learned from our neighbors that it also comes with a small bowl of veggies. ASK FOR IT! mix it up with the noodles and ENJOY!

The mango chicken was pretty good, but probably 3rd ranked out of the items we ordered. Don't get me wrong.. it's still good. It has a nice sweetness to it with a slight spiciness.

I left full. Happy. and with $9 in my pocket for dessert. oh, and not to forget... onion breath. ALL WORTH IT.

Sit on the far right side when facing the kitchen. Not only do you get bombdiggity food... you get a butt massage from the vibrating dishwasher! WOOOOOT WOOT! hahaha. Such a great hole in the wall place. Literally. There are probably like 10 stools available.

oh yes, one last thing- PARKING SUCKS.

excerpts: Tea Salad - a bit spicy but good
tea salad.author: James L.
tea salad.review:
The wait is usually about 30 mins. I always get the:
Beef House Noodles - tasty
Tea Salad - a bit spicy but good
Pot Stickers - sweet with a kick, good 

Good pricing - less than $8 a plate

excerpts: Tea salad (so delicious, best thing on the menu!
better than burma superstar's)
You may need two orders.
nommms
tea salad.author: Susan L.
tea salad.review:
Yamo is a hole in the wall run by dragon ladies.  What to expect: great food and kind of intimidating service! 
  
1) wait in a long line.  (although if you come 45 mins before prime dining times, the wait will be really short! 11am, 6pm)
2) sit on a rocky stool at a greasy countertop
3) get yelled at if you don't order within 3 minutes
4) eat elbow to elbow with your neighbors and hear everyone's conversations
5) possibly get yelled at again: "are you done??!", at which point you will pay a ridiculously awesome price for all the food you got with cash only.
6) smell really disgusting after, so bad you would stink up the entire cartrain on bart.

What to eat, to share with one other:
1) Samusas
2) Tea salad (so delicious, best thing on the menu! better than burma superstar's)  You may need two orders. nommms
3) Yamo House Noodles (I like it with pork)
4) Fish chowder noodle soup (my burmese friends say its really good here!)

excerpts: Tea salad was not interrupted.
Both were very good.
Unusually good even, in that, this is well done Burmese food - which doesn't just happen.
Were they worth the kind of evil attitude?
Eh-
yes.
Would they be worth standing in line with the hipsters for an hour on a rainy, cold Friday night?
Probably not.
tea salad.author: Judith M.
tea salad.review:
I meant to order the cold noodles, but ? mango chicken? came out of my mouth. Tea salad was not interrupted. Both were very good. Unusually good even, in that, this is well done Burmese food - which doesn't just happen. 
Were they worth the kind of evil attitude? Eh- yes.  Would they be worth standing in line with the hipsters for an hour on a rainy, cold Friday night? Probably not.

excerpts: Tea salad:
Simply AMAZING!
So perfectly balanced, vibrant, and flavorful.

I still have dreams about this salad.
-  House noodles with PORK:
So simply, yet satisfying with perfectly cooked tender morsels of pork
tea salad.author: Allison T.
tea salad.review:
Holy hole-in-the-wall batman!!! 

It's not often that I immediately fall in in love with a restaurant but this was love at first sight/bite.

LOVE LOVE LOVE!
-  The cute lady with short curly hair manning the saute station is so bad ass and pumps out dishes like nobody's business.  (just ignore the fobbiness/rudeness)
-  The teeny tiny bar area where you sit allows you to watch all the action.
-  $6/dish?!  What a steal!
-  Tea salad:  Simply AMAZING!  So perfectly balanced, vibrant, and flavorful.  I still have dreams about this salad.
-  House noodles with PORK:  So simply, yet satisfying with perfectly cooked tender morsels of pork and oh so garlicky.

I cannot wait to come back and try every damn thing on the menu.  The only advantage Burma Superstar has is more seating but for taste, Yamo really is the star!

excerpts: The tea salad was exceptional, spicy and flavorful.
It's definitely too salty to eat by itself but leaves your mouth wanting more.
I would probably eat this with rice next time.
The portion was teeny tiny!
Maybe they were factoring in the takeout box?
Think of this as an expensive Asian coleslaw.
tea salad.author: Theresa D.
tea salad.review:
Once you see this place, you'll see that it's a true hole in the wall. There's exactly 8 bar stools for seating. I would not suggest coming with more than 2ppl in your party. Seating is tough as you can imagine. You're basically sitting at the chef's counter in the kitchen. The whole restaurant is one room. 

Expect that Asian service! But with that service comes authentic Asian food, cooked in a wok, in a room where the windows are caked in grease. Yum.

Don't shower before you come here because you'll just end up smelling like food and grease afterwards and have to shower again! 

The tea salad was exceptional, spicy and flavorful. It's definitely too salty to eat by itself but leaves your mouth wanting more. I would probably eat this with rice next time. The portion was teeny tiny! Maybe they were factoring in the takeout box? Think of this as an expensive Asian coleslaw.

excerpts: We had tea salad, cold noodles and mango chicken.
Tea salad was ok but no match to tea leaf salad from Burma superstar, sorry YAMO.
tea salad.author: Dasha T.
tea salad.review:
It did not taste like Burmese, more like Chinese. Chinese with a lot of   "ground fresh chili paste". We had tea salad, cold noodles and mango chicken. Tea salad was ok but no match to tea leaf salad from Burma superstar, sorry YAMO.  Waitress handled money and food without washing hands in between, I am not a big fun of it. 

tip: all dishes were really HOT, so if you are not big fun of HOT food, ask to make it mild.

Personally, I would rather go to good Chinese or to good Burmese instead of Burmese / Chinese YAMO. 

Dining setting reminded me street food of Bangkok, not a bad thing but not for all.

excerpts: Tea salad tastes awesome.
Rest of the food we ordered was very good too.
The restaurant was run by 3 chinese/Burmese ladies.
Very authentic.
tea salad.author: Andi B.
tea salad.review: Awesome small Burmese restaurant. Super authentic food. Good pricing, super fast service. The food is prepared in front of your eyes and you can see how fresh everything is. Tea salad tastes awesome. Rest of the food we ordered was very good too. The restaurant was run by 3 chinese/Burmese ladies. Very authentic.

excerpts: Tea salad was disappointing here.
Where were the flecks of tea and why was it super tiny to the extent that it looked like cheapo leftovers from Burma Superstar?
tea salad.author: Kevin L.
tea salad.review:
I get that oil is the vehicle for taste at these kinds of places, but Yamo douses everything. I caught myself tapping each forkful of noodles so that I could pretend the drippage would make it any less fatty. I got the cold noodles thinking that'd be refreshing on a warm day. Nope, warm noodles mixed with a ton of garlic flakes and chicken. While tasty, it was on the smaller side for what $6 will get ya in that part o' the Mission.

Tea salad was disappointing here. Where were the flecks of tea and why was it super tiny to the extent that it looked like cheapo leftovers from Burma Superstar?

excerpts: Tea Salad and the House Beef Noodle.
Tea Salad: WOW!
DID SOMEONE SPILL SALT?
Because this "salad" was WAY SALTY.
I know I tend to eat on the blander side, but man, this dish needs to be toned down dramatically.
The ingredient was nicely paired though, as there are lettuce with nuts, giving it a mixture of soft and crunchy, creating an interesting combination.
tea salad.author: Luby H.
tea salad.review:
Not sure what the hype is about here either, apparently, I was told that I had it all wrong, and the 4 stars comes with the experience of sitting inside this little hole-in-the-wall and dining at the enclosed space watching the mom & pop cook. Unfortunately, I took the food to-go, and I am writing this review solely on the taste of the food. 

Ordered: Tea Salad and the House Beef Noodle.

Tea Salad: WOW! DID SOMEONE SPILL SALT? Because this "salad" was WAY SALTY. I know I tend to eat on the blander side, but man, this dish needs to be toned down dramatically. The ingredient was nicely paired though, as there are lettuce with nuts, giving it a mixture of soft and crunchy, creating an interesting combination. Only if it was 50% less salty, this would have been a great item.

House Beef Noodle: This tasted like a better version of beef chow mien, but still pretty similar. A bit on the oily side, but I am sure that's how Burmese food is supposed to be. The flavor was great though, and you definitely get a generous amount of beef. Was it amazing though? I say no. 

If I happen to pass by the area again and was desperate for a quick bite, I would give Yamo another shot, and actually sit there to dine for the "whole experience", but this isn't something I would fly from LA to SF for.

excerpts: House noodles (noodles with fried garlic) and beef, tea salad, and samosas were all so good!

The beef on top of the noodles was so tender and flavorful - I think if you add just a bit of the chili sauce on top of your house noodles and mix it all around, it'll make this dish even more fantastic.
If you aren't down for greasy foods though, either don't bother to come here or just avoid these noodles.
But you should seriously try them...
The portion size of the tea salad is actually pretty small, but it's definitely worth trying!
The samosas were also pretty good, the potatoes that they put in them is somehow mixed with some sort of spice or other vegetable that makes them surprisingly sweet and tasty.
tea salad.author: Cheston W.
tea salad.review:
Cheap, greasy, and delicious. Need I say more? These three older women sure know how to run this hole-in-the-wall efficiently and successfully. Just off of Mission on 18th Street, you'll notice a line of hipstered out peeps standing outside of a random store. That, is, in fact, Yamo. The place is literally like eight bar table seats where you pretty much are eating your meal and watching the three women cooking and shouting to each other (in what I think is Cantonese!) as the orders come in. The food comes out real fast and your meal is so tasty, you'll probably down in less than 20 minutes.

House noodles (noodles with fried garlic) and beef, tea salad, and samosas were all so good! The beef on top of the noodles was so tender and flavorful - I think if you add just a bit of the chili sauce on top of your house noodles and mix it all around, it'll make this dish even more fantastic. If you aren't down for greasy foods though, either don't bother to come here or just avoid these noodles. But you should seriously try them... The portion size of the tea salad is actually pretty small, but it's definitely worth trying! The samosas were also pretty good, the potatoes that they put in them is somehow mixed with some sort of spice or other vegetable that makes them surprisingly sweet and tasty. The pot stickers were also pretty good - they did a good job of preventing the pot stickers to be full of juices (like what happens at some other places).

Overall, great food and a great experience. If you love trying something different and I guess actually typical of SF hole-in-the-wall businesses, give this place a try. It's good stuff!

excerpts: Then they throw a mediocre tea salad on the menu and call it Burmese.
tea salad.author: Sasha K.
tea salad.review:
Wow. What a piece of crap restaurant.

Full disclosure: I wouldn't throw myself on the hip-Burmese-food bandwagon, but my opinion on Burmese food is irrelevant, because this wasn't it. This is bad, cheap, oily, and totally flavorless, run-of-the-mill chain Chinese food (cooked by two Chinese people). Then they throw a mediocre tea salad on the menu and call it Burmese.

I got "curry" fish -- fish fried in way too much oil (and I love me some oil) with a slight pinch of curry powder, a heap of undercooked green bell peppers and onion wedges and a huge mound of overcooked rice -- and the "tea" salad, which was slightly better but over-sweet in what tasted pretty much like Italian dressing and, frankly, not all that cheap for a small plate of dry-friend vegetables.

I get it. The service sucks, so it's got to be authentic. (I asked for a suggestion and was glared at in silence before I was handed a peeling menu sticky with other people's food). The wait is long, so it's got to be worth it. (I snuck in before 12, so I only had to wait 10 minutes for my waste of a meal. Yippee.)

Most of all it's cheap (thus, star #2) -- if you calculate on the basis of poundage alone; not sure how it could be considered even OK value when compared to food with flavor. 

But come on, guys. Really? Four stars? Semi-cult following? Stupidly long lines?

This place is honestly terrible.

excerpts: Great House noodle and Tea Salad!
2 stars for service.
HORRIBLE and RUDE.
Seriously you yelled at customers?
tea salad.author: Winson W.
tea salad.review:
4 stars for food. Great House noodle and Tea Salad!
2 stars for service. HORRIBLE and RUDE. Seriously you yelled at customers?

excerpts: Samusas + shrimp spring rolls + tea salad + beef curry over noodles = can't lose!
tea salad.author: Lorraine Y.
tea salad.review:
What do you do when you want affordable Asian food in the Mission District and Mission Chinese is CLOSED ON A WEDNESDAY? As I found out go for Yamo (it must mean in "yummy" in Burmese)!

Samusas + shrimp spring rolls + tea salad + beef curry over noodles = can't lose!

My only worry is that they'll get too popular for their own good and jack up the very reasonable prices for current menu items. Oh well, I'll enjoy the heck out of this literal hole in the wall as long as I can!

Useful info:

- CASH ONLY
- line out the door so call in your order
- limited seating in a tiny space means you will walk out of there smelling like the food
- this part of the Mission looks a bit shady at night so go with a friend

excerpts: Well worth the wait and be sure to try the tea salad.
tea salad.author: Shannon G.
tea salad.review: If your looking for an authentic ethnic experience, definitely check this place out. Well worth the wait and be sure to try the tea salad.

excerpts: Ordered the tea salad.
Theres no tea in it.
But was delicious though.
Full of onion and vinegar, seems would go well with rice porridge too, it's got that Chinese pickle vibe to it, Chinese pickle is better than Kimchi Da Truth!
tea salad.author: Alvin D.
tea salad.review:
This place was legit, straight up ghetto interior. A tiny hole surrounded by good bars, hustlers, bike thieves, some OGs and hoodlums, and yet I felt at home, safe and cozy. It's big enough for 6-7 people tops, unless you're a midget don't bring your whole squad there and make a scene. Its fucking inconsiderate to wait on that many all at once, go there 1-3  at a time, you and the other human beings will be rewarded by the universe.

The food was good, if you don't like it for being too oily, just tell them to add less oil! If they yell at you, enjoy it! Welcome to the real world you bunch of spoiled, sugar coated brats! 

I loved it. Had the house noodle with beef, was delicious. I covered mine up with real home made chilly sauce, none of that sriracha tomato paste. Don't get me wrong, there isn't anything wrong with sriracha, but it DOES NOT go with EVERYTHING, and it aint hot, so don't call it a hot sauce. When you have the choice of a superior chill sauce in front of your ignorant face, dip that shit in, if u don't add the chill, you'are missing the point! 

Ordered the tea salad. Theres no tea in it. But was delicious though. Full of onion and vinegar, seems would go well with rice porridge too, it's got that Chinese pickle vibe to it, Chinese pickle is better than Kimchi Da Truth!

excerpts:
can within viewing distance INSIDE O_O BIG nono
- small food portions for $5, especially the tea salad!
tea salad.author: CeCe C.
tea salad.review:
Yamo is sadly not yummo. It's YUCKO :(

- question the sanitation of this restaurant
- greasy residue on their plates =\ ew
- there's a black garbage can within viewing distance INSIDE O_O BIG nono
- small food portions for $5, especially the tea salad!
- old women yelling at each other makes my blood pressure go up
- still hungry after eating 3 dishes :(

Avoid eating inside this tiny hole-in-the-wall. If you do plan to order food from here I recommend calling them to place your order, picking it up, and then eating it at home. They run out of a lot of things towards the evening. So go early!!!!

I really wanted to like this place, but I just didn't like the quality of food here. My Mom can make better food than this. I felt the food portions were a bit small for being around $5 a dish. Maybe they thought my friend and I were small and had smaller stomachs? We noticed that the other people around us got larger portions... -.-

Sitting at the small counter and watching these old ladies yell at each other in their native languages made my blood pressure go up! Watch out for Albert Einstein-haired lady, she likes to yell a lot! O_O I guess many of the other customers found it quite entertaining and just laughed in amusement. Untidy kitchen, small sink, etc. I quickly lost my appetite as soon as I saw the black garbage can within 6 feet. O_O

They buy their coconuts from the market, Duc Loi, across the street for 1/2 of their selling price. I wonder if I can be ghetto next time and buy a coconut at Duc Loi, but have Yamo cut it open for me! bwahaha j/k

** Note: Enter at your own risk! **

excerpts: tea salad, stir fry and rice, all too salty and greasy.
tea salad.author: Shuting Z.
tea salad.review:
first time it was nice. great character and ambience of this place.  well I always love soup nazi-type of chefs.  Yet second time, I would have to say everything was disappointing.   tea salad, stir fry and rice, all too salty and greasy.   my fish chowder is so salty and doesn't taste fresh. 

if you come, order mango chicken. it is good.

excerpts: The tea salad is good and has a nice crunch to it.
Mango chicken with rice is a little dry.
tea salad.author: Nam T.
tea salad.review:
I always wanted to try this place but there's always a line. Forget about trying to go to dinner here if you're hungry. During the day it's not so bad. I've been here a few times for Saturday lunch and it is super quiet. 

The salads and the main dishes are $6 and it's decent. There's nothing really special. The tea salad is good and has a nice crunch to it. Mango chicken with rice is a little dry. Curry fish was good. I like the noodles because on a hot day, all you want is some cold noodles. 

Don't expect good service (which I appreciate the loud sassiness of the ladies) or sanitary. Burmese food seem similiar to most SE Asian food so nothing spectacular that there need to be a huge line for. When you're broke, hungry and don't feel like eating Mexican, this is a good alternative place...if u can get in.

excerpts: My date and I had fish curry and tea salad, both highlights of the night.
The curry had plenty of fish and rice, and the mild spiciness topped off the appeal of this dish.
The tea salad was interesting.
Little tea leaves with peanuts, cabbage, and something crispy which I couldn't distinguish, all in light fish sauce.
Mmmm, a good complement to the hearty curry.
tea salad.author: Hannah H.
tea salad.review:
I remember when I visited my relatives in Penghu Island as a child, my late grandmother would bust her ass to make dinner in the stuffy tiled kitchen, and the heat from the cooking pots and pans would waft into the living room where ten people would wait hungrily and chat incessantly. Yamo reminds me of that moment. Three old Burmese ladies dash here and there in the open kitchen, shouting and chatting excitedly while patrons wait at the bar, amidst the sound of sizzling oil and blasts of stir-fry heat.

There's almost always a line of varying length here all day. Maybe it's because this place can only seat seven or eight, or maybe the food is so good. Well, scratch that "or", it's more like "and". I went here once and it has become one of my favorites. My date and I had fish curry and tea salad, both highlights of the night. The curry had plenty of fish and rice, and the mild spiciness topped off the appeal of this dish. The tea salad was interesting. Little tea leaves with peanuts, cabbage, and something crispy which I couldn't distinguish, all in light fish sauce. Mmmm, a good complement to the hearty curry. All together, the bill ran to something like eleven dollars, which is pretty cheap.

They also have grass jelly, but ran out when I went. Oh well, next time.

excerpts: Their Tea Salad was pretty good!
Being someone that doesn't like salads, I enjoyed it.
We also tried a fried curry appetizer but I forgot what it was called.
tea salad.author: Cat P.
tea salad.review:
I would give Yamo four stars, but the service wasn't that great when we dined in. Which is why I HIGHLY recommend take out! Regardless of the service, I can see why Yamo had high reviews because it really is good for being a hole in the wall. 

Their Tea Salad was pretty good! Being someone that doesn't like salads, I enjoyed it. We also tried a fried curry appetizer but I forgot what it was called. For my main dish I got the Yamo house noodles with beef as my choice of meat. They also had chicken and pork, which my other two friends got. There was nothing really special about them, they were just like chow mien noodles. 

For four people dining in we were pushing it since they only had 10 seats, but together our bill came out to being only 34 dollars. You get exactly what you pay for so I don't have much to complain about.

excerpts: Delicious house noodles and tea salad.
tea salad.author: Charlene N.
tea salad.review: Delicious house noodles and tea salad. Skip the curry fish. Expect to sit down and order quickly as there are only 8 seats or so. The cooks are on a mission so don't expect smiles or courtesies like that. Cash only - really well priced. I'd definitely come back!

excerpts: Tea salad and house noodles are top things to get here.
tea salad.author: Lynn J.
tea salad.review: 3.5 This tiny mouse hole in the wall has fresh food cooked in front of you that is super cheap.  Noodles are little greasy but still dank.  Tea salad and house noodles are top things to get here.

excerpts:
Tea Salad - small portion but super tasty
House noodles with pork - delicious
Curry Shrimp over rice - I'd get it with the rice noodles next time, good sauce
Fish Chowder Soup - not my cup of tea but had good flavor

, consistency is a bit thick for my taste
Samosas - looked fresh and hot
tea salad.author: Jen C.
tea salad.review:
Yamo is Yum-o!!!!

This is the perfect stop after a random night of drinking in the mission.  The space is TINY but everyone is so nice and moved down to accommodate my group and the ladies behind the counter serve food like it's no joke.  Considering I was starving I was so happy when food appeared 5 minutes after we ordered.

Tea Salad - small portion but super tasty
House noodles with pork - delicious
Curry Shrimp over rice - I'd get it with the rice noodles next time, good sauce
Fish Chowder Soup - not my cup of tea but had good flavor, consistency is a bit thick for my taste
Samosas - looked fresh and hot but I'm just not a samosas fan
Potstickers - pretty basic but hits the spot.

Seems like a bunch of regulars and lots and lots of takeout orders.  Oh single ladies I noticed a lot of single guys chowing down by themselves at the counter!

excerpts: We ordered tea salad cause
so many yelp reviewers mention it, also mango chicken, the house noodles, and potstickers.

The tea salad was very tasty with a nice peanut crunch, the mango chicken was very flavorful with the contrast between sweet and salty, the noodles with pork were very good and filling, lastly the potstickers arrived last and were flavorful with a fried edge on the bottom side.
tea salad.author: Amado P.
tea salad.review:
My son brought me to Yamo's this afternoon. It was like stepping into a third world dive - it's small, a counter top with 8 stool chairs. It' hot, smoky and greasy with three not very friendly woman behind the counter - one taking orders and serving the food, another doing the cooking just a few feet away, and the third woman prepping veggies nearly in your face. I have to admit it was fun to watch and a lot cheaper than going to Burma. 

We ordered tea salad cause so many yelp reviewers mention it, also mango chicken, the house noodles, and potstickers. The tea salad was very tasty with a nice peanut crunch, the mango chicken was very flavorful with the contrast between sweet and salty, the noodles with pork were very good and filling, lastly the potstickers arrived last and were flavorful with a fried edge on the bottom side. The hot sauce that came with the potstickers was perfect.

The dishes are small so don't come here if you want a huge portion serving; on the other hand, the price for each of our plates was $6.25 and the potstickers were $4.50. Not bad especially since we left very satisfied. For the very hungry, I would simply suggest that you order more food if after your initial order you are still hungry.

Yamo's is not for everyone. As I said it is like stepping into the third world, but for my palate the food was good, the price was right, and I loved the experience. I would definitely go back to Yamo's. Try it out.

excerpts: We ordered the samusas  (this is how they were spelled on the menu), pot stickers, tea salad, and the curry fish.
tea salad.author: V R.
tea salad.review:
Visited for the 1st time last night and was pleasantly shocked how much I enjoyed it.  

Its tiny, only about a dozen seats at the counter and so I can imagine on a busy night there is fair wait, but we waited only about 10 min.  We ordered the samusas  (this is how they were spelled on the menu), pot stickers, tea salad, and the curry fish. Everything was super tasty and the bill came to whopping $20 and change, not bad at all!

Take-out seemed to be a popular option, which makes sense giving the limited seating. Honestly the only reasons I'm not giving it a 5 star is 1. No alcohol... a beer would have been great with that meal and 2. We came at the end of service and do to the limited space the staff was chopping up large volumes of onions next us in prep for the next day which was making my eyes water.  But let me just say, a little eye watering wouldn't deter me from going back!

excerpts: so we ordered the mohinga and green tea salad.
Let me tell you, Chinese it isn't and Burmese it ain't!
Please, do not let what you are having here be the future informant of what Burmese food is supposed to taste like.
It is just disgusting goop that they are disguising as food.
Don't fall for it.
Go elsewhere, anywhere.
tea salad.author: Quoc V.
tea salad.review:
After reading all the great reviews by fellow yelpers, I was looking forward to an evening of mouthwatering and flavorful deliciousness that would transport me back to my recent trip to Burma.  But what I got was attitude and condescendence.  Even if I looked past that, the place is dingy, I mean unhealthyly dirty.

Against my better judgement, the friend convinced me to try the food as take-out so we ordered the mohinga and green tea salad.  Let me tell you, Chinese it isn't and Burmese it ain't!  Please, do not let what you are having here be the future informant of what Burmese food is supposed to taste like.  It is just disgusting goop that they are disguising as food.  Don't fall for it.  Go elsewhere, anywhere.

excerpts: My staples are the Chicken Noodle Soup, Cold Noodle Chicken, and Tea Salad with a Grass Jelly drink.
You'll never have better Burmese food in the states...
tea salad.author: Fuu C.
tea salad.review:
One of my favorite places to eat... EVER. I would recommend this place to anyone unless you're not down for a lil divey grime. 

This place feels like a legit S/E Asian street food spot and the the food is so tasty you'll find yourself coming 3-4x to satisfy your Yamo's fix. Yeah, you might have to wait awhile, but if you go in the off-hours, you'll find that there's always a spot to sit down. Yeah, the mamas will yell at you if yer actin' a fool, so... Don't do that. 

My staples are the Chicken Noodle Soup, Cold Noodle Chicken, and Tea Salad with a Grass Jelly drink. You'll never have better Burmese food in the states...

excerpts: I ordered the cold noodles with a tea salad and it was whipped up in just a matter of minutes!
I gave this place only four stars because the service is eh, kinda iffy.
On a side note ordering in advance and picking up your order seems like the best way to a) cut interaction with "angry" cooks and b) enjoy your meal in the comfort of your own home.
tea salad.author: Amy Y.
tea salad.review:
One word, and one word only - DELICIOUS!

This was my first but definitely not last experience at Yamo. So it's a hole in the wall restaurant, ya-da-ya-da-ya-da... however their dishes are just bursting with spices and unique flavor. I ordered the cold noodles with a tea salad and it was whipped up in just a matter of minutes! I gave this place only four stars because the service is eh, kinda iffy. Okay, yes I'm aware of different cultural norms - but if this is your first time ordering and the lady is yelling at you for not brining cash, sheesh I would be a bit thrown off.

Regardless, I will be back and just as a suggestion - I wouldn't recommend this as a place to get a quick bite! Every time I've stopped by the line is out the door. On a side note ordering in advance and picking up your order seems like the best way to a) cut interaction with "angry" cooks and b) enjoy your meal in the comfort of your own home.

excerpts: Other dishes are serviceable but among the best dishes is also the tea salad  (when they have it) which is a wonderful mixture of tea leaves and other ingredients that will remind you of the Thai papaya salad.
This sounds strange but really works and worth a shot...at least twice!
tea salad.author: Sunay P.
tea salad.review: A pretty decent little Burmese place that serves a hodge podge of Burmese and other food that is a generic swipe through Southeast Asia.  Pretty decent friendly service and showing any interesting in really exploring Burmese food, gets you some smiles and at time dishes which are modified to make them more "authentic".  Personal favorites is the khaosay essentially chicken sauteed in ginger-garlic-shallots and turmeric finished off with coconut milk and topped with noodles.  Chopped peanuts on top and fresh green chilies and life is good...especially on a cold day.  Other dishes are serviceable but among the best dishes is also the tea salad  (when they have it) which is a wonderful mixture of tea leaves and other ingredients that will remind you of the Thai papaya salad.  This sounds strange but really works and worth a shot...at least twice!

excerpts: We ordered the tea salad, mango salad, and house noodles with chicken.
They were $6 each.
The tea salad was the star of the meal, at least for me!
Such interesting flavors, satisfying crunch from fried peas and fried peanuts, spice from chilis and fried garlic.
tea salad.author: A.L. H.
tea salad.review:
TIP: The seating is basically one bar with 8-10 seats. If it's full, wait right outside. As people finish up, one of the 4 ladies behind the counter will ask you what your order is. Once people leave, you can scoot in and take your spot. Your food will be ready in minutes!

TIP #2: If you need water, just ask for it. The ladies hear you and will give you a cup of water shortly. Don't expect any other service, really! The ladies are probably too busy cooking to notice that you've finished eating, so wave your money at them, they'll check it with your order slip, take your money, and you can free up some space for the next customers. 

Delicious and just the right amount of food. My sister and I, starving at around 8:30pm, waited for 15-20 minutes for spots to open up. The wait can be worse, she said. We ordered the tea salad, mango salad, and house noodles with chicken. They were $6 each. Portions were just right. 

The tea salad was the star of the meal, at least for me! Such interesting flavors, satisfying crunch from fried peas and fried peanuts, spice from chilis and fried garlic. Near the end of the salad, the pieces were too small for me to grab with my chopsticks, so I (shamelessly) picked the plate up and shoveled every last bit into my mouth. 

The mango salad was tangy and refreshing. Again, the melding of flavors and textures--slightly sweet and spicy, smooth mango and crunchy toppings--worked together beautifully. 

The house noodles were a bit bland. The chicken was nicely cooked, but the noodles themselves lacked flavor (and had a pretty good layer of grease). I had to use some chili hot sauce to put some life into it, but it came out steaming and fresh. 

We watched the ladies work their magic, efficiently and elegantly managing 3-4 pots and pans at once. Mesmerizing. It is what it is--bare bones service, delicious satisfying food that comes out fast, an unforgettable and unique experience.

excerpts: Walked in ordered the tea salad( or cabbage slaw because thats all it really was) the house noodles and the curry fish.
My girlfriend decided to take a picture of the food in front of us and the owner yelled at us " wat du
yu not undestand no piktures!"
First of all there are no signs posted saying no pictures, secondly, you never warned us a first time.
This made the whole experience the worst experience I've ever had in a food establishment.
Dont remember if the food was bland because I was angry or because it did not have flavor, a bit of both perhaps.
And for that I will never come back to this little Rat hole in the wall (
i wouldn'd be surprised if a colony of rats live their)...
tea salad.author: chris B.
tea salad.review: Came to this place for lunch with my girlfriend after looking for a unique place to eat in the city. What a HORRIBLE mistake. Walked in ordered the tea salad( or cabbage slaw because thats all it really was) the house noodles and the curry fish. My girlfriend decided to take a picture of the food in front of us and the owner yelled at us " wat du yu not undestand no piktures!"...... First of all there are no signs posted saying no pictures, secondly, you never warned us a first time. This made the whole experience the worst experience I've ever had in a food establishment.Dont remember if the food was bland because I was angry or because it did not have flavor, a bit of both perhaps. And for that I will never come back to this little Rat hole in the wall ( i wouldn'd be surprised if a colony of rats live their)...

excerpts: I've had the potstickers, tea salad, black bean fish and all the tofu dishses (curry, black bean and mushroom) so far
tea salad.author: Favoloso M.
tea salad.review:
Cheap and cheerful is how i would describe this place.  90% of the time I have to wait for a seat along this miniscule establishment and its slim counter space.  The menu is small but everything I've had is tasty delicious.  I've had the potstickers, tea salad, black bean fish and all the tofu dishses (curry, black bean and mushroom) so far and they've all been good!

Cash only and be prepared to smell like cooking when you leave.

excerpts: Also when she made our food with her bare hands in between handling money (for example making the tea salad with her hands after just handling money) she was also coughing, sneezing and yelling/spitting over our food.
The actual food was good, but given the entire experience it's just not worth it.
I used to order takeout from here at least once a week for our office i've given these guys so much business
and she just pissed away a loyal customer.
Will never go here again and recommend anyone looking for a great eat-in experience to steer clear, it's just not worth it!!!
tea salad.author: aneel r.
tea salad.review:
Avoid like the plague!

Ordered $60 worth of food with 2 friends and asked for take-out but then literally 30 seconds later when i noticed there were 3 free seats and NO ONE in line i asked if i could eat there. The women proceeded to yell, scream and wave at me and told us we already said take-out and couldn't change our minds and refused to let us stay and eat there - she hadn't even started making the food yet let alone packaging things we had only just ordered. Then, she proceeded to take other orders of ppl who came after us and sat them down and served them food before even starting to make our food. We waited 30 minutes until finally i asked if we were going to get our food and she yelled at me some more before finally starting to make our food which we got like 45mins maybe even an hr after first entering. Also when she made our food with her bare hands in between handling money (for example making the tea salad with her hands after just handling money) she was also coughing, sneezing and yelling/spitting over our food. The actual food was good, but given the entire experience it's just not worth it. I used to order takeout from here at least once a week for our office i've given these guys so much business and she just pissed away a loyal customer. Will never go here again and recommend anyone looking for a great eat-in experience to steer clear, it's just not worth it!!!

excerpts: The tea salad is phenomenal and may be worth the wait!
tea salad.author: Romita J.
tea salad.review: Total hole in the wall which is awesome in terms of its uniqueness/ ambiance. The food overall unfortunately is just average though, so unless you like salad may not be worth the long line. The plus is you actually see the chefs making the food as the only seating available is in the kitchen. The tea salad is phenomenal and may be worth the wait!

excerpts: In terms of food, I absolutely loved the Tea Salad (tea leaves, cabbage, tomato, onion, dried shrimp, and crunchy beans and sesame seeds).
The beans were definitely the secret ingredient, adding a nice crunch and nutty flavor to the dish.
tea salad.author: Rose J.
tea salad.review:
I would give 5 stars for the "hole in the wall" atmosphere and the endearing two ladies sweating away in the kitchen area orchestrating five hot skillets and a boiling deep-fryer. 

In terms of food, I absolutely loved the Tea Salad (tea leaves, cabbage, tomato, onion, dried shrimp, and crunchy beans and sesame seeds). The beans were definitely the secret ingredient, adding a nice crunch and nutty flavor to the dish.  However, I think the Yamo House Noodles with Beef is what is making me "EH" about this place.  The beef was nice and tender.  However, the egg noodles were sauteed with not enough garlic and SERIOUSLY a quart of oil. It was SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO FREAKEN greasy. I've made noodles with more yummy garlic and less oil then what was in that bowl.  I felt pretty gross after that.  

It's a great place to go late at night after a few beers and you are HUNGRY...but if you already have a muffin top like me...go with caution. :)

excerpts: No, but it's cheap, fast and pretty tasty - especially the Tea Salad.
The experience sets it apart.
First, the place is tiny - REALLY tiny.
There are about 8 stools and the kitchen.
That's it.
Second, there doesn't seem to be any ventilation.
I felt like I was walking into a wall of grease.
(As an aside, don't plan to do anything other than take a shower after you leave here.)
Last, but certainly not least, the service is bad in the best way.
They're prompt and you better be, too.
I felt like I broke a rule when I wasn't ready to order right away.
I received a look of death before she walked away, only to come back in about a minute.
All of this would send me packing elsewhere, but it's somehow endearing.
tea salad.author: Brett B.
tea salad.review: Yamo gets an extra star for entertainment value. The food here is pretty good. Amazing? No, but it's cheap, fast and pretty tasty - especially the Tea Salad. The experience sets it apart. First, the place is tiny - REALLY tiny. There are about 8 stools and the kitchen. That's it. Second, there doesn't seem to be any ventilation. I felt like I was walking into a wall of grease. (As an aside, don't plan to do anything other than take a shower after you leave here.) Last, but certainly not least, the service is bad in the best way. They're prompt and you better be, too. I felt like I broke a rule when I wasn't ready to order right away. I received a look of death before she walked away, only to come back in about a minute. All of this would send me packing elsewhere, but it's somehow endearing.

excerpts: I had the chicken curry, tea salad, and dumplings.
tea salad.author: adam m.
tea salad.review:
I experienced Yamo for the first time last night and was truly delighted. The atmosphere is great- bar seating only with a max of about 12 people, orders taken and food prepared by 3 cheerful ladies. Perfect authentic/inexpensive dinner with entrees priced at $5.25 and appetizers at $3.25.

I had the chicken curry, tea salad, and dumplings. All were fantastic.

Get you some!

excerpts: I would get the mango salad or the tea salad to balance the oil in the food.
I don't think I've had Burmese food that's been this heavy.
It is a bit greasy, especially the noodles-
but the house noodles are really tasty.
The beef is so soft and tender ~ it's similar though to beef in Chinese beef chow fun, but more tender and tasty.
tea salad.author: Wendy L.
tea salad.review:
Everything on the menu is $6.00.  Cash only. Please~ don't come here with a posse of more than 2 and then sit like you have an hour to catch up and look through pictures of their dog/kid/ trip to Europe. The set up when it's busy goes like this.

1. Stand in line
2. Order at the counter while waiting and standing in line.
3. Sit down and promptly served
4. Eat (served water) . Eat (ask for water). Eat. Eat ( ask for some more water).
5. Pay Bill/ Ask for to go boxes
6. Leave. 

Follow this and you'll enjoy a great cheap meal. I would get the mango salad or the tea salad to balance the oil in the food. I don't think I've had Burmese food that's been this heavy. It is a bit greasy, especially the noodles- but the house noodles are really tasty. The beef is so soft and tender ~ it's similar though to beef in Chinese beef chow fun, but more tender and tasty. The curries are more salty, less creamy, but with slight hints of tumeric and curry powder~ don't expect heavy Thai or Indian curry flavors. 

II would definitely go back again and wait in line to try their other dishes and order their house noodles again.

excerpts: We quickly ordered the tea salad, mango chicken, samusas, along with 2 fresh young coconut drinks.
tea salad.author: Solitaire M.
tea salad.review:
One does not dine at Yamo for the customer service or ambience. But that's okay, I'm not that uptight/high maintenance. 

My friend and I came here on a weekday around 3 PM, parked in the secret cheap parking garage and walked down the charming Cornwall St. We only waited for a couple minutes, squeezed our way over to the counter and hung our items on hooks behind of us. We quickly ordered the tea salad, mango chicken, samusas, along with 2 fresh young coconut drinks. Using two hands, we clunked our coconuts together in light of the delicious meal we were about to devour.

The price is affordable in comparison to the other name Burmese restaurants in SF. I didn't think our food was greasy nor did I think the 3 women "threw" anything at us. I did notice one of the women serving two people next to us who kept asking for things and she kept saying "Yah, yah, yah," and looking annoyed. I thought she knew them, but I don't think she did haha! 

Yamo seems a good fit for singles or duos who are low maintenance, on a budget, are in the neighborhood and there is no wait.

excerpts: The tea salad was okay, a bit spicy and very crunchy.
Smaller then I expected, and just okay not more.
The mango chicken dish was hideous at best.
Badly made.
And I'm usually forgiving when I'm super hungry
so I guess it was extra awful.
My cat liked it though.
I thought the white rice was the best out of the take out.
Not coming back here.
tea salad.author: Mashav S.
tea salad.review: Darn it! I wanted to like this place so much! But I didn't. I have my bus back home just outside their place so I thought I could get a Take Out while waiting to the bus and eat at home. I asked the lady in charge how long it would take and she said 10 minutes so with a but 13 min away I went for it. I asked for mango chicken and tea leaf salad. 13$ for both, charged in advance. So I waited and waited and asked if it's ready from time to time. It wasn't, they didn't even started. They might have started 10 minutes later, and 3 minutes before the bus came she said it's 2 minutes ready. It wasn't. I saw the bus passing by and my food was not even in the box. A minute later I got the bag and had to wait 20 more minutes for the next bus. It HAD to be good enough to compensate for this long wait to get home. It wasn't. The tea salad was okay, a bit spicy and very crunchy. Smaller then I expected, and just okay not more. The mango chicken dish was hideous at best. Badly made. And I'm usually forgiving when I'm super hungry so I guess it was extra awful. My cat liked it though. I thought the white rice was the best out of the take out. Not coming back here.

excerpts: My friends and I shared samusas, the tea salad, and we each got our own entree dish (I got the curry fish with noodles)
Samusas were great, well seasoned with enough kick to give your tongue a tickle.
Tea salad was great too--a lot like the "tea leaf salads" you get at other Burmese restaurants, but this place is a bit more authentic.

Tea leaf salads traditionally are made with cabbage (which this one was)... but at most establishments like Burma Superstar or Pagan, they use romaine lettuce since we Americans eat more romaine than cabbage.
Curry fish was OK, but my friends who got the curry chicken and mango chicken loved theirs.
The curry fish, which had batter around it, wasn't deep-fried, but instead was panfriend, a lot like how my mom cooks it.
I would have preferred it to be deep-fried, that way the fish is a lot crispier. .
.so
instead, everytime I ate each bite of fish, it was like chewing into something kinda soggy...
tea salad.author: Matthew L.
tea salad.review:
What an interesting establishment!  

It was like going to a diner, but instead serving Chinese/Burmese food.  The food was pretty tasty, although on a little on the greasy side...but hey, that's restaurant food.  My friends and I shared samusas, the tea salad, and we each got our own entree dish (I got the curry fish with noodles)  Samusas were great, well seasoned with enough kick to give your tongue a tickle.  Tea salad was great too--a lot like the "tea leaf salads" you get at other Burmese restaurants, but this place is a bit more authentic.  Tea leaf salads traditionally are made with cabbage (which this one was)... but at most establishments like Burma Superstar or Pagan, they use romaine lettuce since we Americans eat more romaine than cabbage.  Curry fish was OK, but my friends who got the curry chicken and mango chicken loved theirs.  The curry fish, which had batter around it, wasn't deep-fried, but instead was panfriend, a lot like how my mom cooks it.  I would have preferred it to be deep-fried, that way the fish is a lot crispier. . .so instead, everytime I ate each bite of fish, it was like chewing into something kinda soggy...so that didn't sit too well on my palate, despite the good flavor.

Pricing of this food is really cheap--the appetizers are like $3.25 and entrees are like $5.25.  So you definitely get full way fast at such a low price.

The place is opened by 3 Chinese ladies.  Me being Chinese I couldn't help but listen in on their conversations.  I found their conversations to be quite entertaining!

Since this place only seats about 8-10 people, there is usually a line out ther door.  Last night, when my friends and I went...it was raining, but fortunately when we had gotten in, there were 4 seats for all of us.  There really isn't a "prime time" for eating dinner, since it's pretty crowded during all hours of dinner time.

excerpts: The tea salad is by far my favorite
and I highly recommend it.
tea salad.author: Little C.
tea salad.review:
I used to live right down the street from this place - which meant I could conveniently stop by when the lines for this tiny place were not so long (rarely). Even if you're not so lucky to avoid the lines - it's totally worth the wait. 

The tea salad is by far my favorite and I highly recommend it. The black bean fish is a close second. 

The women who run the place are also really great. Watching their process behind the counter is pretty impressive.

excerpts: As far as food goes, I'm a huge fan of the Tea Salad, House Fried Chow Mein, and Yamo House Noodles.
tea salad.author: Trevor U.
tea salad.review:
Yamo's food quality deserves 3 stars, but the experience in itself deserves 4 stars.  

There is always a line at Yamo!  It might be because the hole in the wall that Yamo calls home is comparable in size to a muni car.  And let's be honest, riding muni during rush hour sucks.  You can never get a seat at the bar and you're constantly rubbing shoulders with people to order.  Once you do get your opportunity to order, you better do it correctly or else the intimidating Burmese women might let you have it.  

For starters, I'd recommend hitting up Yamo during non-peak hours.  If you do manage to get a seat at the bar, I'd recommend sitting as far away from the door as possible.  I'd also recommend getting a fresh coconut to sip on while you wait.  

As far as food goes, I'm a huge fan of the Tea Salad, House Fried Chow Mein, and Yamo House Noodles.  Don't expect much from these dishes in terms of size as everything on the menu is only $6.  

I highly recommend Yamo because it is a unique experience.  You probably won't be able to absorb another experience like this one anywhere else in San Francisco. 

*If you're looking to eat and beat the line, call your order in and pick it up 15 minutes later.  It definitely beats the crowd on a cold San Francisco night.

excerpts: The tea salad is beauty on your tongue.
tea salad.author: Shawn C.
tea salad.review:
The tea salad is beauty on your tongue.

The samosas are crispy and delicious.

The house noodles are never greasy, always tasty.

You'll walk out smelling like the kitchen with a big smile on your face.

I want these women to be my Chinese grandmothers.

excerpts: We had fish chowder noodle soup and tea salad.
The portion of the tea salad is extremely small.
It's definitely tapas size appetizers and it costs $6 or $7.
As for the flavor... I have had better.
tea salad.author: Ricki H.
tea salad.review:
I went there with two of my girlfriends and we were not impressed. May be we didn't order their signsture dishes? We had fish chowder noodle soup and tea salad. 

The flavor of the soup is bland and the soup is not hot. It's warm. I think it's due to the fact that they use rice cooker to make the soup. It's definitely easier for customers to eat and makes the turnover faster. Unfortunately there's nothing memorable about the  noodle soup to us. 

The portion of the tea salad is extremely small. It's definitely tapas size appetizers and it costs $6 or $7. As for the flavor... I have had better. It's not bad but nothing memorable. 

It's a pity cuz this place appears to be one of those hole in the wall type amazing local restaurants for quick and awesome food. However, it is truly not it and the line is long and not worth it.

excerpts: The tea salad is whats up!
Its delicious and spicy (though yes, small but c'mon
it's 6 bucks).
Would definitely go again!
tea salad.author: Ivy M.
tea salad.review: Awesome for a solo diner. The tea salad is whats up! Its delicious and spicy (though yes, small but c'mon it's 6 bucks). Would definitely go again!

excerpts: House noodles are the best, curry rocks, and you have to try the tea salad at least once.
tea salad.author: Naomi M.
tea salad.review: Best dive restaurant in the neighborhood.  Just 12 stools at the counter so you focus on ordering / eating / leaving.  House noodles are the best, curry rocks, and you have to try the tea salad at least once.

excerpts: I'm completely infatuated with the tea salad at Burma Superstar, but thought I needed to give Yamo's version a try after seeing all the rave reviews.
Love the army of ladies shuffling around the small kitchen and the cramped quarters, but the next time I have a craving for tea salad
, I'm heading to Burma Superstar.
tea salad.author: Lee H.
tea salad.review:
I'm completely infatuated with the tea salad at Burma Superstar, but thought I needed to give Yamo's version a try after seeing all the rave reviews. 

Yes, it's less expensive, but it's also decidedly a smaller portion than Burma Superstar. The cabbage, tomato, onion, dried shrimp, fried beans and nuts were all present, but I couldn't help thinking that the pungent fermented tea flavor that makes this salad so special was missing. 

Love the army of ladies shuffling around the small kitchen and the cramped quarters, but the next time I have a craving for tea salad, I'm heading to Burma Superstar.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Tea Salad and I tried a little bit, it was a nice blend of crunchy and spicy nom noms!
tea salad.author: Brian H.
tea salad.review:
While in San Francisco (visiting from Orlando) I decided to try this place out after discovering about it on Yelp.

This is defiantly one of those places you probably wouldn't stop in and eat at if you are just walking or driving by... but the line leading out of the door and down the street during the lunch time rush would convince you otherwise.

On this particular day it seems like they had one person working on carry out orders and 1 or 2 of them working on sit down orders, so they seemed to be moving people through as fast as they could.

There is roughly about 8 seats at a bar to sit and eat at, so expect to wait or carry out if you're in a hurry.  My friend and I managed to get some seats.  The staff are really nice; they move pretty fast without necessarily leaving you with the feeling that you're being rushed.

I got the house noodles with beef.  I absolutely despise cilantro... which apparently the houe noodles contains, but that aside, the food was amazing and at ~$6 in San Francisco, out right a miracle.  My friend ordered the Tea Salad and I tried a little bit, it was a nice blend of crunchy and spicy nom noms!

I would say the only negative thing about this place is the lack of proper ventilation.  As noted in some other reviews, if you sit to eat, you will come out smelling like the food.

excerpts: Tea salad and Chow Fun with Chicken were AmAzing!
tea salad.author: Manu M.
tea salad.review: Tea salad and Chow Fun with Chicken were AmAzing!

excerpts: Reason behind it is because beside the House Noodles, Chicken Noodle Soup, and Tea Salad, there's not much to eat.
All the other dishes were A-OK.
The spring rolls were actually kinda disappointing...
the rice skin was too thick...not enough ingredients on the insides..and the sauce was mediocre at best.
The CURRY dishes were alright...cause there just isn't enough sauce, although the potatoes in them were really good; they were fried and then stir fried.
Then again, I don't know too much about Burmese food.
tea salad.author: Jonathan C.
tea salad.review:
After coming back to this place a few times, I've decided to downgrade it to 3 STARS.  Reason behind it is because beside the House Noodles, Chicken Noodle Soup, and Tea Salad, there's not much to eat.  All the other dishes were A-OK.  The spring rolls were actually kinda disappointing...the rice skin was too thick...not enough ingredients on the insides..and the sauce was mediocre at best.
The CURRY dishes were alright...cause there just isn't enough sauce, although the potatoes in them were really good; they were fried and then stir fried.  Then again, I don't know too much about Burmese food.  Maybe that's the way it was meant to be.

Having said that, if you haven't tried the place yet, you should.  Cause the House Noodles are just THAT GOOD.

excerpts: Yellow curry fish, baby Thai coconuts and TEA SALAD!
Brilliant.
Try it out!!
tea salad.author: Lauren S.
tea salad.review:
Cheap, fast, home-cooking right in front of your eyes - always packed (which is a great thing) great location, and friendly, family-vibe service.

Yellow curry fish, baby Thai coconuts and TEA SALAD! Brilliant. Try it out!!

excerpts: The tea salad, and fresh spring rolls.
Go to Yamo and drink a coconut already.
You will be glad you did.
tea salad.author: Maria D.
tea salad.review:
Yamo, Yamo where have you been all my life? So there are so many overpriced places in this town, and for the most part, they are not even close to being as good as this no-frills hole in the wall. So you put it on a fancy plate and serve it to me with a hot waiter in a crisp white shirt doesn't make the wallet assault any less insulting. 

At Yamo there is a short counter space at which you can plop down, the ambiance is hot Burmese kitchen and not hot SF hotspot, but the lovely ladies there cook up some gorgeous fresh plates of yumminess, AND they chop off the top of the fresh coconut entirely: so you can get at all the fresh coconutty goodness. Some places don't do this...why I ask you? It is like $2.50 for the coconut. $5.25 for each entre. I love the vegetable curry noodles. The veggies are cooked perfect (they are still somewhat crisp) and includes okra. Yumo. Flavors pop, appetizers rock. The tea salad, and fresh spring rolls. Go to Yamo and drink a coconut already. You will be glad you did.

excerpts:
this Tea Salad! 

eat enough of this tea salad to be inspired to overthrow the Myanmar government and restore Burma? 

On with the tea salad and Hot House Noodles!
tea salad.author: Jon A.
tea salad.review:
if this Indiana balcony I'm on was just a Spring retreat and not full-time living...it'd make me feel a whole lot better being 1,945 miles away from Yamo. From a place that makes me feel like I can walk in alone and feel like I did when I'd wander into my Grandma's kitchen as a kid. 

But my Granny ain't know nothin' 'bout this Tea Salad! 

If I ate too much of this fine, not-too-wet, not-too-dry, just enough peanut salad, I'd start yammering Burmese on the streets. 

Wait...maybe that's my destiny...eat enough of this tea salad to be inspired to overthrow the Myanmar government and restore Burma? 

Wait, then we wouldn't have Burmese refugees that open many a Yamo. A crux!

Most of the time...there was a line...but there are only what? 11 seats? Your match.com date will be queasy if you show any signs of indecision. But again...be prepared for a bit of wait...play Bear, Ninja Cowboy.

Keep your party 2 or less or you'll just be plain troubled and will end up ordering take out, which is well & good but you'll miss out maybe sitting next to someone who says "Fahhhnta," instead of "Fanta."

Chicken came off slightly dry but I expected such with the flash quick fry they gave it. 

Embrace the dive-feel the same way you embrace the dive feel of The Attic. 

Don't be afraid to chat up the cooks either...they're not as austere as you think...warm, really, just terse. And terse is good, because on with the Yamo food! On with the tea salad and Hot House Noodles! 

Wiley cheap too, as in $6 for dinner.

excerpts: Tea salad:  Pretty good if you can handle all the dried beans and garlic.
tea salad.author: Yvonne Y.
tea salad.review:
Tea salad:  Pretty good if you can handle all the dried beans and garlic.  That garlic was potent and looooooooonglasting.

Chicken noodle soup:  ramen, chicken, onions in a yellow curry coconut soup.  Fantastic.

Get the fresh coconut drink for $2.50 only.  Same price in Mexico!

excerpts: Tea Salad is a must, a dish that can be inhaled or savored with equal enjoyment.
Fish with black bean sauce delights the diner crafty enough to chop and stick their way to a quick meal.
Where is flavor country you ask?
It is Burma, full of Buddhist monks.
But for San Franciscan Monks, may I suggest trying out Yamo, for health.
tea salad.author: Amy S.
tea salad.review: Yamo delves into depths of the psyche as it overwhelms the sensory lobes of the mind with it's richness. Textures rule the day, freeing the mouth to explore realms as diverse as fallen snow and gritty earth. Tea Salad is a must, a dish that can be inhaled or savored with equal enjoyment. Fish with black bean sauce delights the diner crafty enough to chop and stick their way to a quick meal. Where is flavor country you ask? It is Burma, full of Buddhist monks. But for San Franciscan Monks, may I suggest trying out Yamo, for health.

excerpts: The tea salad was also a must have.
Make sure you have something to drink along with this salad.
My sister had the Mango Chicken.
tea salad.author: Kenneth L.
tea salad.review:
I'm glad to be the 600th reviewer of this hole in the wall. 
I was in the bay area for a family trip and decided to trek down here after the reviews from my fellow yelpers. My father was so pissed off that he decided to storm off before even trying the food. Well, he missed out. The House Noodle with Beef was the best damn noodles i had in SF. I wolfed down the bowl of cilantro beefy goodness in no time. The tea salad was also a must have. Make sure you have something to drink along with this salad. My sister had the Mango Chicken. The mango chicken was okay at the very best. 

There are about 9 stools, one chef, and 2 waiters in the place. Make sure you don't come in groups and prepare to wait for a long time. The price was reasonable. Our bill came out to be about 24 for 3 people including tips. Just order take out.
The dishes looked like they were mish mash together. Don't expect any heartfelt stories from this place.  The chef was this tired 50 yr old woman. She told us a chef made all the sauces and prep everything. All she had to do was put it together. She recommended the House Noodle and the Fish Chowder Noodle.

My father ended up chowing down on my sis' mango chicken because he was waiting by the street corner while we ate. I love how karma works.

excerpts: Always in my order: tea salad & house noodles.
Hard to beat.
tea salad.author: A S.
tea salad.review:
Quick, extremely tasty food. 
Super cheap. 
Environment to match.

Always in my order: tea salad & house noodles. Hard to beat.

excerpts: House specialty noodles are superb, tea salad very good, and curry
okay
(it was just spicy and not much else to me).
tea salad.author: Kozmo C.
tea salad.review: Delicious cheap Burmese food in archetypal hole-in-the-wall eatery.  Oft grumpy-looking Asian ladies run the place very much like street food carts in Asia, where everything seems at once makeshift yet operated with ruthless efficiency.  Food is not as sophisticated as Burmese Superstar, but perfectly comforting and pack in that explosive savory Burmese flavor as you would expect.  House specialty noodles are superb, tea salad very good, and curry okay (it was just spicy and not much else to me).  Delightful to have a fresh coconut as beverage.  Probably need to come at strategic time to avoid long wait.  I am a fan!

excerpts:
What we ordered:
Tea salad - nothing special
Samosas - alright, dry and one of the samosa had a strong 'SOUR' smelling in the stuffing aka expired...yucky!
Cold chicken noodle - decent and chicken quite tender.
tea salad.author: Katy N.
tea salad.review:
Went there last night with a friend that said 'is really good', I beg the differ! The food was mediocre and boy was I circling for almost 30 mins to find parking - EPIC PAIN!

The extra star given cuz to my delight the 3 'MOMS' aka chefs were busting out Cantonese (when one would think 'Burmese' after all, this is a Burmese restaurant) talking smacks and mocking two customers on what they ordered - COMICAL!

What we ordered:
Tea salad - nothing special
Samosas - alright, dry and one of the samosa had a strong 'SOUR' smelling in the stuffing aka expired...yucky!
Cold chicken noodle - decent and chicken quite tender.
Curry fish rice - rice was stale hard. Could barely taste the curry and the fish was quite edible.

Not worth the parking hassle for me to ever return....just sayin'

excerpts: On the massive recommendations, I tried the Mango Chicken with a Mexican coke while my friend had the tea salad.
She mentioned that the salad "had a kick", and I would say the same for the Mango Chicken.
My chicken came on a plate with white rice and crispy fresh stir fried veggies.
Nothing was too oily, salty, or spicy.
This dish was exactly what I hoped it would be.
tea salad.author: Eric G.
tea salad.review:
This has to be the best new discovery for me in a long time.

I have never had Burmese food until today. I met a friend and we were seated pretty quickly. This place is one long counter and the food is cooked right in front of you. 

On the massive recommendations, I tried the Mango Chicken with a Mexican coke while my friend had the tea salad. She mentioned that the salad "had a kick", and I would say the same for the Mango Chicken. My chicken came on a plate with white rice and crispy fresh stir fried veggies. Nothing was too oily, salty, or spicy. This dish was exactly what I hoped it would be. The big chunks of mango made this dish even better, as I love the taste of mango with chilies. 

The staff was so polite to us given the pace that they have to keep to make sure the line outside does not get too long. This place obviously is popular and for good reason.

Next time I plan to try some noodles because I sat and watched them make dish after dish of a noodle dish which just looked amazing. I am also interested in their fresh coconut milk. Oh they have not seen the last of Eric G.
