excerpts: Based on Yelp recommendations, we got the tea salad which was a lot smaller than I expected
The Tea Salad was pretty good.
While it was small, it was indeed very flavorful.
tea salad.author: Kristie G.
tea salad.review:
This place was not worth the hype at all.  We went at around 3pm since we didn't want to hit the lunch hour rush.  Based on Yelp recommendations, we got the tea salad which was a lot smaller than I expected (1/2 the size they give you at Burma Superstar), the house noodle with beef, and the curry prawns.  

The Tea Salad was pretty good.  While it was small, it was indeed very flavorful.  I'm not sure what they put in this, but it's pretty addicting. 

The Curry Prawns are pretty spicy.  The shrimp is just your normal frozen shrimp with a light curry sauce with some onions, mushrooms, and bell peppers.  I wasn't a huge fan but it also wasn't horrible. 

I had high hopes for the House Noodles but while the texture of the noodles were good, the taste is just like any other place that stir fry's in egg noodles in a ton of oil.  The noodles are extremely oil with pretty mild flavor.  I think the chow mein noodles at a decent chinese restaurant are equivalent to what they serve here. 

When people say "hole in the wall" they're not kidding.  The place looks very run down and the counter seating is very squishy.  Apparently there are lines out the door during lunch time, well that's because there is absolutely no space inside the door if you don't want to be rubbing shoulders with someone.  I also noticed that this place had no ventilation so I felt like I was suffocating just waiting for my food.  

Would probably not come back unless I was drunk but I guess it wasn't a bad experience, but not something crave-worthy.

excerpts: Once I was hunkered down along the counter, I set my sights on the young coconut, the tea salad, and the chicken noodle soup -- based on a fellow Yelper's recommendations.
YUM!
The tea salad is a party in your mouth.
So many flavors, and so much crunch.
I loved it.
The chicken noodle soup is not to be confused at ALL with good ol' Campbells in a can.
This soup is more like a spicy curry - and it's very, very good.
I ordered a spring roll as a starter, and it was fine, but not thrilling.
Pretty standard spring roll.
tea salad.author: Molly P.
tea salad.review:
I heart Yamo.  Good Burmese food, but also a fun/bizarre TINY hole in the wall that is an experience in and of itself.  I have actually had a frustrating experience of waiting 45 minutes for a delivery order that I had placed on the phone BEFORE driving to Yamo, so that was infuriating, but given that the whole place consists of three women and a space the size of a walk-in closet, I decided to let it go.  

After only experiencing Yamo via take-out, I ate inside Yamo this evening.  I loved it!  First of all, it feels like an accomplishment just to get a seat because there are so few.  Once I was hunkered down along the counter, I set my sights on the young coconut, the tea salad, and the chicken noodle soup -- based on a fellow Yelper's recommendations.  YUM!  The tea salad is a party in your mouth.  So many flavors, and so much crunch.  I loved it.  The chicken noodle soup is not to be confused at ALL with good ol' Campbells in a can.  This soup is more like a spicy curry - and it's very, very good.  I ordered a spring roll as a starter, and it was fine, but not thrilling.  Pretty standard spring roll.  The young coconut was delicious - and it's fun to drink directly from a straw in a coconut!

All of this for $16.50!

This place gives a new meaning to "hole in the wall."  If you haven't gone, you must!

Also - don't forget to have cash on hand.  They don't take credit cards.

excerpts: They did have some healthier options on the menu that looked interesting though, like the tea salad and the mango salad.
The place is often crowded with a line out the door, but that's partly because it's literally a hallway with a cramped row of bar stools-no tables here.
Once I got in though, the service was speedy.
I'd eat here again, as an alternative to fast food, greasy Chinese or a taco, but not a place for a romantic date, unless your date is impressed by your ability to spot descent hole in the walls.
When you eat here think of it as kinda like a Burmese version of Tulan in the Tenderloin.
tea salad.author: Juan F.
tea salad.review: Tasty and very cheap! I had the beefy curry with noodles for $6! This place doesn't combine their Burmese recipes in the same delicate fashion you'd find at Burma Star in the Richmond, but their food was flavorful, albeit a little greasy and a wee bit salty. They did have some healthier options on the menu that looked interesting though, like the tea salad and the mango salad. The place is often crowded with a line out the door, but that's partly because it's literally a hallway with a cramped row of bar stools-no tables here.  Once I got in though, the service was speedy. I'd eat here again, as an alternative to fast food, greasy Chinese or a taco, but not a place for a romantic date, unless your date is impressed by your ability to spot descent hole in the walls. When you eat here think of it as kinda like a Burmese version of Tulan in the Tenderloin.

excerpts: I had the tea salad which was a pretty small portion (so order something else too)
but it is so so tasty.
The prices are good and the ladies behind the counter are hilarious, shouting all the time and laughing while they cook.
It's a small place and the kitchen is open.
I would recommend it to anyone, fellow vegetarians and meat lovers alike!
tea salad.author: Amy C.
tea salad.review: This place looks rundown and almost not even open from the outside but it fits in perfectly with the mission vibe. It's a hidden gem and the food is delicious! I had the tea salad which was a pretty small portion (so order something else too) but it is so so tasty. The prices are good and the ladies behind the counter are hilarious, shouting all the time and laughing while they cook. It's a small place and the kitchen is open. I would recommend it to anyone, fellow vegetarians and meat lovers alike!

excerpts: I would recommend the tea salad, curry prawn (spicy), and Yamo house noodles, WITH GRASS JELLY TEA.
tea salad.author: Philina L.
tea salad.review:
Yamo was an experience.  The restaurant is as wide as a hallway and as short as an elephant.  You sit at the front of the kitchen so you feel the heat, smell the food, and see the fire.  When you receive your entree and take your first bite you know that you are getting quantity and quality for a good price.  Each entree is $6- max.  

I would recommend the tea salad, curry prawn (spicy), and Yamo house noodles, WITH GRASS JELLY TEA. 

MM-MMM.

excerpts: Tea Salad - $5.25
, It's cheaper but smaller than the ones you'd find in the Richmond District.
It's also spicier.
The ingredients weren't as colorful and fresh looking as I'm used to.
I prefer more of the nutty taste
so I was hoping for more sunflower seeds and peanuts.
tea salad.author: Julia T.
tea salad.review:
3.5 stars. My friend and I were semi-wandering around the Mission looking for dinner since I already had a motive to try Yamo... When we were close, I excitedly said "ooo let's have some Burmese!" I'm slick like that. ;) As we approached the place, we realized it was probably cash only and I only had $3 in my wallet! Good thing there was an ATM close by. We were also lucky that someone seated by the only empty seat was leaving! We secured our spots and looked over the (VERY grimy) menu. The waitress if you'd like to call her that was very friendly and was patient with our indecisiveness. We ended up with:

Samosas - $3.50, This was actually the spiciest thing I had that night! It's fried right in front of you so it comes out fresh and hot. It's made with some kind of yam and spices but I honestly couldn't taste much because my tongue was in pain! 

Tea Salad - $5.25, It's cheaper but smaller than the ones you'd find in the Richmond District. It's also spicier. The ingredients weren't as colorful and fresh looking as I'm used to. I prefer more of the nutty taste so I was hoping for more sunflower seeds and peanuts. I'd probably skip this one next time.

Fresh Coconut Juice - $2.50, Pretty sure everyone has had one of these but that doesn't make it any less tasty! It's a real, young coconut with the top cut off served with a straw and a spoon so you can dig into the coconut meat after you finish the juice. I say it's way worth it since you could pay that much just for a coconut at the market. I'm also too afraid of trying this at home again. Coconut shells are like rocks!

Mango Chicken - $5.25, with your choice of house noodles or white rice. I got the noodles and they were quite tasty! They were eggy and chewy in the good way. My friend was surprised they had real mango chunks and they were big too! This dish also came with green peppers, bits of chili peppers (so more spice!) and big flavorful chicken chunks. It was good but this dish was also a bit greasy. 

I'm not a fan of spicy food, though I'm getting more tolerable. It helps when all your friends like spice and INSIST that THIS THE TIME I'm going to start liking it. Nope never happened. I still thought Yamo was above average but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

excerpts: and we ordered the tea salad, mango chicken, and yamo house noodles with chicken.
My favorite was the tea salad.
I didn't see them make it
but I think they have this mixture of nuts or something that goes really well with the salad.
tea salad.author: Faye F.
tea salad.review:
3.5 stars

I stumbled upon this restaurant when I was blog surfing. This past weekend, my boyfriend and I ventured down mission to find this hole in the wall. The food is absolutely delicious but you WILL have to wait awhile (depending on the number of cooks working and the line of customers) for it. When we arrived, there were 3 female cooks working their butts off for a small line. The place itself can hold maybe 10 sitting customers and the rest order to go. There's no order when serving their customers and it seemed like it's easy for them to forget your order, especially when there's a long line of customers. 

Anyway, my boyfriend and I hadn't eaten all day and we ordered the tea salad, mango chicken, and yamo house noodles with chicken. (You can also order fresh coconut drink, which they will cut up open for you on the spot!) The mango chicken with rice was very good. It didn't feel heavy in your stomach and the vegetables were pretty fresh. My favorite was the tea salad. I didn't see them make it but I think they have this mixture of nuts or something that goes really well with the salad. The house noodles were super garlicky and it was good! 

This is a good place to eat if you have a lot of patience waiting for food but I suggest not to go during lunch rush.

excerpts: Ordered the tea salad, mango chicken and Yamo house noodles with chicken.
The tea salad was the standout of the three dishes.
Nutty and crunchy.

Tea salad
+Price
-Slow service
-Limited seating
tea salad.author: Daniel M.
tea salad.review:
Came here last Saturday because my girlfriend wanted to try it. It's just a few blocks from the BART station but we had to walk through a pretty dirty and smelly portion of the Mission. I'm not sure I would have found it if I hadn't seen a picture of it before we came. Anyway, we arrived around 3pm and didn't have trouble finding a couple stools at the bar (there's only 10). 

Ordered the tea salad, mango chicken and Yamo house noodles with chicken. The tea salad was the standout of the three dishes. Nutty and crunchy. My house noodles were sort of bland but perked up when I added some hot sauce. The cooks were generally inattentive and the service was fairly slow. But you can't beat the $5.25 price for entrees!

Summary: 3.5/5 stars rounded down
+Tea salad
+Price
-Slow service
-Limited seating

excerpts: The tea salad is spectacular, as are the house noodles and cold noodles.
YUM YUM YUM in my tum tum tum
and it never fails to satisfy me (big portions) despite how cranky I am from standing in a line outdoors.
The ladies who cook are so involved in what they are doing, and are (inadvertently) really funny at times as they argue (sometimes screaming) with oneanother.
But hey, if I was working in a small, fast-paced, busy crowded space with several other women, it would be bound to happen to me too!
tea salad.author: Jessica M.
tea salad.review: This place is INCREDIBLE. It is as funky as it gets, and has very limited seating, AND usually has a crazy line around mealtimes, BUT it is D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S (and very inexpensive)!!! The tea salad is spectacular, as are the house noodles and cold noodles. YUM YUM YUM in my tum tum tum and it never fails to satisfy me (big portions) despite how cranky I am from standing in a line outdoors. The ladies who cook are so involved in what they are doing, and are (inadvertently) really funny at times as they argue (sometimes screaming) with oneanother. But hey, if I was working in a small, fast-paced, busy crowded space with several other women, it would be bound to happen to me too!

excerpts: We sat down at the counter, and quickly decided what we wanted: samosas, tea salad, house noodles with chicken.
Tea Salad: Yum!
Definitely on par, if not better than anything that Burma Stupidstar serves.
tea salad.author: Faffy L.
tea salad.review:
Every morning, I board the 33 and sit on the left side of the back of the bus. I'm pretty woozy while the bus is leaving the Richmond, but I somehow wake up by the time I hit the Mission. I've seen Yamo and their red awning with fancy disco type (I think a designerd fan donated some graphic design skillz to this joint) through the window a bunch of times, but I never figured out what the hell it was until a month ago, when I squinted really hard and saw people sitting at the counter eatin' one afternoon.

I went home, looked Yamo up to see what kinda food it served and went there one day after work armed with tips I got from fellow Yelpers.

My bf and I showed up on a Wednesday at around 5pm, the place was empty and the Yamo ladies were still prepping for the dinner crowd. We sat down at the counter, and quickly decided what we wanted: samosas, tea salad, house noodles with chicken.

After a few minutes of sitting around and feeling awkward, food just started showing up in front of us. 

Samosas: Careful! Might burn your mouth!! Light and crispy is right, but the flavor is good, but not really special or anything. OH! They give you like 8pcs, so even 3-4 people can share.

Tea Salad: Yum! Definitely on par, if not better than anything that Burma Stupidstar serves. They can easily slap this on a fancy plate and charge $15 for it.

House Noodles: I was anticipating more of a garlicky flavor, but it was very tasty anyway. The chicken is well marinated and the cold onions/cucumbers you get is great to balance out the grease.

Going to Yamo totally feels like barging into a neighbor's house and just sitting down and getting fed, sans the southern hospitality. The Yamo women are tough and can't be bothered. One of them reminds me of my grandma. If you are ready for the bill, don't sit there and ask for it. Pack yo bags and head to the register, they'll know what's up.

Our bill with a drink was maybe just like $15.

I don't think you need to be THAAT adventurous of a eater to go there. It's not like they serve rabbits or anything, ya know what I mean?? Even if they do, I'd definitely go back. =D

(Originally) 4.5 stars!

5/23/07 I'm bumping this up to 5 stars because I've had 4 more dishes from here and it's really the fricken bomb!

excerpts: Order something that seems good (Tea Salad, Noodle bowls, Curry).
And you watch the ladies cook it for you.
They serve it to you and you eat.
Delicious.
I feel like I came home!
tea salad.author: Ali K.
tea salad.review:
This tiny gem of a place deserves a review. I've been torn, because I don't want them to get all trendy and popular (resulting in me waiting in a long ass line like at Swan's), but I guess this is the right thing to do. Plus I doubt you will find it - it is quite hidden.

The experience: You sit down at the counter. Order something that seems good (Tea Salad, Noodle bowls, Curry). And you watch the ladies cook it for you. They serve it to you and you eat. Delicious. I feel like I came home!

excerpts: Tea salad is awesome
tea salad.author: Tony N.
tea salad.review:
Just countertop dining. True family joint that is operated by a couple of really tough ladies who are very friendly.

Not a place to bring a significant other who is high maintenance.

Tea salad is awesome

excerpts: As we arrived, I was already dreaming of the "tea salad", samusas and curry.
While I read a few reviews raving about the tea salad and how it is so much better than Burma Superstar's version, I must WHOLEHEARTEDLY disagree.
There really is very little tea leaf in the Yamo tea salad.
The samusas were average, but nothing to go out of the way for.
The beef curry that I ordered was dripping with oil, lacked any flavor (no spice at all)
Yes, it is cheap (2 curry meals, 1 tea leaf salad, 1 order of samusas =
$19.20 w/o tip) and
it may be convenient for some, but I just can't imagine eating there again.
The food was pretty flavorless and just too greasy for me to handle a second time around.
tea salad.author: Hiromi N.
tea salad.review:
After reading many of the 4-5 star reviews of Yamo, the boyfriend and I were truly looking forward to having our taste buds treated to a great surprise tonight as we drove out to the Mission.  As we arrived, I was already dreaming of the "tea salad", samusas and curry.  

There were some positive things that I took note of right away:

94% inspection rating (hanging on the back wall)
Family owned and run
The ingredients looked fresh (as the ladies were peeling & chopping items right in front of us).
The young lady serving us was quite friendly and customer service oriented.

Yet, I must say that I was EXTREMELY disappointed with the food.  While I read a few reviews raving about the tea salad and how it is so much better than Burma Superstar's version, I must WHOLEHEARTEDLY disagree.  There really is very little tea leaf in the Yamo tea salad.  While tasty, it is almost comparable to campbell's "chicken" noodle soup, where the chicken flavor is there, but the chicken is MIA from the whole equation.  

The samusas were average, but nothing to go out of the way for.  The beef curry that I ordered was dripping with oil, lacked any flavor (no spice at all) and I just couldn't make myself finish it.

Yes, it is cheap (2 curry meals, 1 tea leaf salad, 1 order of samusas = $19.20 w/o tip) and it may be convenient for some, but I just can't imagine eating there again.  The food was pretty flavorless and just too greasy for me to handle a second time around.  :(

excerpts: The tea salad was a heap of disappointment.
Highly salty and spicy hot, it contained a TON of little fried crunchy things.
Fried onions, fried garlic, fried pumpkin seeds, fried lentils, fried batter bits; you get the picture?

Oh, it had a small amount of shredded cabbage too, thinly sliced red onion, peanuts, sesame seeds and trace amounts of green onion, but by far the prevailing theme here was oil and drenching things in them.
The crowning glory was that it was toped with cilantro.
tea salad.author: Mortiche W.
tea salad.review:
The safety training officer said, "Always trust your instincts- they are right 99.9% of the time." Damn right he was. When I walked in here the first thought in my mind was, "Hello Susie's on 7th and Townsend!" Susie's is a greasy spoon cafe run by two Chinese women. You SMELL like grease even if you just poke your head inside for 2 seconds. 

Undaunted and confident that my Yelpers wouldn't lead me wrong I orderd two standards- tea leaf salad and the cold noodles with chicken. 15 minutes the little lady behind the counter said. 

I stood just inside the door secretly wishing I could prop it open, and watched as the two ladies ran a bumbling and inefficient orchestra of food preparation. One would do something- i'm not quite sure what, but it wasn't very purposeful- causing the other to fall behind on whatever she was doing. One was fishing out some fried egg rolls from the fryer and the other mumbled to her that she should get my order finished and out the door since I had been there for more than 15 minutes and my food had been sitting in it's containers for at least 5, waiting for lids. 

I managed to escape the grease pit and drove back to work with my windows all the way down the entire way, trying to shake off the lingering tell-tale scent of a greasy spoon joint; much like a hooker's cheap perfume marking a travelling business man's shirt.

So how was it? The tea salad was a heap of disappointment. Highly salty and spicy hot, it contained a TON of little fried crunchy things. Fried onions, fried garlic, fried pumpkin seeds, fried lentils, fried batter bits; you get the picture? Oh, it had a small amount of shredded cabbage too, thinly sliced red onion, peanuts, sesame seeds and trace amounts of green onion, but by far the prevailing theme here was oil and drenching things in them. The crowning glory was that it was toped with cilantro. Shoot me now.

Deciding I had enough disappointment/torture, I moved on to the cold noodles with chicken, and this was an odd dish because given the name, one might be led to believe that the dish is actually cold. Oh, no my friend. This it is not. The chicken was cooked in a mildly spicy chili/onion oil/sauce. Have I mentioned the oily mess yet? If I didn't twirl the noodles perfectly, it would flick oil. Onto my face, my clothes, my desk. It was like noodle oil bukkake. Not only was I smothered in it from the inside out, but now I'm being bathed in it too. 

After a few more bites of coating my arterial walls, I claimed surrender and put a lid on the offending meal. I felt as if I had cooking oil poured over me, and have had an uncontrollable desire to take a long, hot showers with industrial strength Dawn since then. Just because a place is inexpensive, doesn't mean it needs to be greasy.

Up-side: at least I won't have to moisturize or use conditioner for the next week. I have enough oil on me for the EPA to send out auditors. Exxon-Valdez ain't got nothin' on me.

Instinct says: Don't trust good Burmese cuisine to come from a place that smells NOT like cooking and food, but of grease, run by two Chinese women.

excerpts: #1 is the tea salad.
DELICIOUS!
Had just enough spice and kick to make you wanting a sip of water, but it was all out awesome!
#2 is the chicken noodle soup.
It had this velvet-buttery taste that was sensational!
OMG!
tea salad.author: Nicolas H.
tea salad.review:
Prices seriously can't be beat. I think we stuffed ourselves with food the other night for like twenty bucks or something like that? It was insanely crazy.

Now, I will say that it's a small place, so those that are claustrophobic should not come in here. About 10 stools in total. You sit at the counter and you watch the ladies work their magic. Kinda cool actually. :)

The food was a bit too spicy for my tastes...and the curry beef dish was pretty plain. Nothing special about it really.

I wil make two recommendations. #1 is the tea salad. DELICIOUS! Had just enough spice and kick to make you wanting a sip of water, but it was all out awesome! #2 is the chicken noodle soup. It had this velvet-buttery taste that was sensational! OMG! That'd hit the spot on a cold night.

All in all, it's cut and it definitely has it's personality.

Would I force someone to come all the way across town for it? Probably not. But would I ask someone to eat there if there were in the hood? Definitely at least once.

excerpts: I had Tea Salad without dry shrimps, on my request, veggie spring roll, like the peanut sauce and a fresh coconut.
tea salad.author: Yi Z.
tea salad.review:
I read all the review before I hit Yamo.
     Actually I looked for it about 6 months ago and did not find the place (I know, shame on me).
     I can see both sides of the story on Yamo.  So I let go of my high and low expectation and decided to simply experience Yamo as it is yesterday evening, when I was craving greasy noodles with lots of vegetables.

And I did enjoy it, the "Mommy" and Auntie made me Yamo noodles with vegetables and tofu, no even on the menu.  I had Tea Salad without dry shrimps, on my request, veggie spring roll, like the peanut sauce and a fresh coconut.  I cannot say for my ex for his Mango chicken with rice, but I did enjoy my share very much.

Love the little cave, smoke alarm going off from time to time, because it reminded me when I was cooking Chinese food in my own studio in Madison, WI.  

I guess it is more of a personal projection thing, I wanted mom made stir fried noodles, watching mom cooking and the feelings going with it.  And I got it all.  Seeing daughter and mom and aunts are busing preparing meal for you is comforting some times for some one.

So if this is what you are looking for, you may be very satisfied, like I was ;)

excerpts: Make sure to try the tea salad (so many crunchy goodies mixed in).
tea salad.author: Xtina C.
tea salad.review:
I love nothing better than little ethnic hole-in-the-floor joints with great food for practically nothing.  Thus is Yamo.
Sure you leave smelling something of recycled grease, but the flavorful food and very friendly people behind the counter more than make up for it.
Make sure to try the tea salad (so many crunchy goodies mixed in).  The cold noodles are delish, the black bean fish was good and the curries are nice and spicy.
And for such a no-frills place, it's nice that they have an array of condiments.

excerpts: I had the tea salad, chicken curry over rice, and house noodles with chicken.
The tea salad had great flavor to it and was more memorable to me than Burma Superstar's.
The house noodles were also very tasty with the fried garlic on top.
The chicken curry over rice was good, but I think next time I'll order over noodles.
I don't know if it's just an illusion, but it looked like if you order noodles they give you more.
tea salad.author: Joann C.
tea salad.review:
Very cheap, yet tasty.  I had the tea salad, chicken curry over rice, and house noodles with chicken.  The tea salad had great flavor to it and was more memorable to me than Burma Superstar's.  The house noodles were also very tasty with the fried garlic on top.  The chicken curry over rice was good, but I think next time I'll order over noodles.  I don't know if it's just an illusion, but it looked like if you order noodles they give you more.  I saw other people with the veggie curry and it looked great. 

The food here is greasy.  It's not for people looking to lose weight or count calories.  It's for a good quick meal that's extremely easy on the wallet.  The other reviewer is right.  All the noodles are coated in oil as is all the vegetables in the curry.  Just FYI - the potatoes in the curry look like they're pre-fried earlier in the day then boiled when you order curry to heat them up.  

(Also, ideally you'd go to the bathroom before coming here.  It's not unusable, but it's not a pleasant experience.)

excerpts: Tea Salad, House Noodles with Beef and Broccoli and Chicken Soup (with coconut milk) and don't forget to get the whole fresh coconut as well.
tea salad.author: Anna C.
tea salad.review:
Yummy comfort food.  Like eating in your Aunt's kitchen.  

Favorites: Tea Salad, House Noodles with Beef and Broccoli and Chicken Soup (with coconut milk) and don't forget to get the whole fresh coconut as well.  Just try not to splash the person next to you with coconut juice while attacking the flesh like I did.  

 All of this would cost you less than $20.  How the heck do they make money?  I like Burma.

excerpts: Try: tea salad, black bean tofu, veggie curry, fresh spring rolls (
tea salad.author: Suzanne S.
tea salad.review:
Yamo is not the best Burmese food around, but it's a great place for a no frills meal that is fresh, tasty, made to order, and *cheap*! It's a wonderful little oasis of tortilla-less cheap food in the mission.

The place is very unique, and some people may be turned off by the fact that it is literally a hole-in-the-wall.  For those people, I suggest taking it to go and eating it at home or in one of the nearby parks.

Despite the Tu-Lan-esque vibe, the food is always super fresh and not as greasy as you  might imagine (although I can't speak for meat dishes ) They make everything, even the fresh springrolls,  for you right in front of your eyes. And they've always agreed to make anything I've requested vegetarian for me, which means they fill it with a wonderful mix of familiar and unusual fresh veggies, herbs and/or tofu. yum.

Try: tea salad, black bean tofu, veggie curry, fresh spring rolls (peanut sauce is awesome), mango tofu, and fresh coconut juice!

All apps are $3.25 (and the spring rolls by themselves can be a great light lunch), entrees are $5.25. 

don't be turned off by the fact that it looks like it's closed or abandoned. it's definitely worth a try, especially if you live in the area.

excerpts: Tea Salad
Mango chicken
tea salad.author: Leah E.
tea salad.review:
I would have never found this place in a gazillion years if not for Yelp!  Thanks, Yelpers!!!

(Now I am in big trouble after finding this place!! I go to meetings around the corner from Yamo few times a week.  It will be hard to skip the place.  I just have to remember to bring cash everytime.)



Date:  November 25, 2008 at 11:58 AM

Occasion: Lunchbreak. Food to go.

Venue: The place is cute:  like a grandma's kitchen in Asia kind of cute.
              The whole place is a kitchen with counter seatings for 9.
              Think Asian, rustic version of the Mario Batali Kitchen.
 
Decor: None. Rustic. Simple. Basic
             Stove, pots and pans
              One long counter seating.

Social Scene:  I was the only person at the place aside from the two old ladies cooking.  I had the best seat in the house and was very much entertained watching them cook.  One customer came in and picked up her phoned-in order.

Taste:  I ordered "Curry fish with steam rice"  Spicy. Fish was fresh and melt in your mouth. YAMOLICIOUS!!! Get it? ;)

Future Taste:  Tea Salad
                           Mango chicken
                           Everything on the menu which is a short-list.

Tab:  $5.25 ( no tax/no tip jar in sight)

Skip:  Dining at Yamo if you are claustrophobic like me.  This place is good for meals to go.  Otherwise, you will be eating elbow to elbow with the person right next to you.  

Downside:  Cash only.
                      You'll end up smelling of food while waiting for your order.
                      Forget about privacy. Save your racy stories for dessert somewhere else.

excerpts: As we know, my current obsession is Burmese tea salad, and Yamo delivers in this department.
Not overly oily, (my only criticism of Burma Superstar's rendition), this tea salad smacks of tea, with about a hundred other flavors going on at once.
Sweet, salty, savory, spicy.
I love the chickpeas, dried fava (?
) beans, fried garlic, and fried peanuts.
tea salad.author: Kathleen G.
tea salad.review:
As we know, my current obsession is Burmese tea salad, and Yamo delivers in this department. 

Not overly oily, (my only criticism of Burma Superstar's rendition), this tea salad smacks of tea, with about a hundred other flavors going on at once. Sweet, salty, savory, spicy. I love the chickpeas, dried fava (?) beans, fried garlic, and fried peanuts.  And it's made authentically with shredded cabbage, instead of romaine lettuce.

Also, for a whopping $5.25, you can have a heaping place of about a thousand other curries and stirfries. I'd suggest mango chicken salad. Less so the beef curry.

excerpts: Tea salad.
YUM!
House Noodles--pretty tasty, as well!
Spring rolls, too?
Our bill was ridiculously small considering how much food we had.
Perfect meal after a monster workout, too!
tea salad.author: Aim B.
tea salad.review: How have I never been here before??  I *LOVE* hole in the wall places like this with counter only seating and brusque service.  Efficiency at its best!  We were still standing outside when they started our order and had our food served up by the time we got to our seats.  Tea salad. YUM! House Noodles--pretty tasty, as well!  Spring rolls, too? Our bill was ridiculously small considering how much food we had.  Perfect meal after a monster workout, too! :)

excerpts: It was cold today and all I wanted was a big bowl of Yamo chicken noodle soup and a tea salad.
When I left my soul was humming.
I think right now, that is my favorite meal in San Francisco.
tea salad.author: Dan L.
tea salad.review: Do you know that feeling of content when you get exactly what you want?  It was cold today and all I wanted was a big bowl of Yamo chicken noodle soup and a tea salad.  When I left my soul was humming.  I think right now, that is my favorite meal in San Francisco.

excerpts:
Tea Salad:  $5.25
 - 4.5 stars
 -
Tea leave, cabbage, fresh tomato, oion, dried shrimp & variety of fried bean, nuts and sesame seeds.
- Wow, by far my favorite dish of the day.
This taste and texture explosion is so good
I wish they served it in meal portions, but alas, they only served it as a relatively small and light plate.
More like an appetizer.

It's got a variety of crunchy textures, including what feels like tiny croutons though with a saltier taste (I'm assuming it's the fried bean but might of been the dried shrimp), and the nuts (which I'm guessing may be peanuts), and the more raw veggie crunch of the cabbage.
There are also several software textures as well as the watery tomato texture.
And the taste?
Wow, there's a raw veggie tanginess to it, subtly to it, saltiness to it....
Really, explosion is the only way to describe.
And it does this so cleanly and lightly that none of the tastes are overbearing.
tea salad.author: Tetsu N.
tea salad.review:
Today was my very first experience eating Burmese food, and from what I'm told, everything here is very authentic, or at least authentic from the perspective that identically prepared delectable delights can be had over there.

Meeting a very old friend from back in NY who happened to be in town, we went to Yamo based on her SO's recommendation.

What a treat!  I love experiencing new kinds of food!

The restaurant itself is ridiculously small, with only some limited counter seating, maybe seating 10 or so.  The restaurant looks like it has been around for a while too, and was incredibly popular.  The line was constant and always out the door, tho luckily, it seems that most who get their food here have are well aware that getting takeout is a much wiser choice.  

And the prices!  Excellent prices for the cheap bastard in me.  My friend and I had three dishes, a coconut drink, and a soda for under $20.  For light eaters on a budget, one dish and a drink would be about $7 combined.  Big eaters won't go broke either.  

On to the food.

Tea Salad:  $5.25
 - 4.5 stars
 - Tea leave, cabbage, fresh tomato, oion, dried shrimp & variety of fried bean, nuts and sesame seeds.
 - Wow, by far my favorite dish of the day.  This taste and texture explosion is so good I wish they served it in meal portions, but alas, they only served it as a relatively small and light plate.  More like an appetizer.  It's got a variety of crunchy textures, including what feels like tiny croutons though with a saltier taste (I'm assuming it's the fried bean but might of been the dried shrimp), and the nuts (which I'm guessing may be peanuts), and the more raw veggie crunch of the cabbage.  There are also several software textures as well as the watery tomato texture.   And the taste?  Wow, there's a raw veggie tanginess to it, subtly to it, saltiness to it....Really, explosion is the only way to describe.  And it does this so cleanly and lightly that none of the tastes are overbearing.  This is a MUST ORDER at this small little hole in the wall.

Fish Chowder Noodle Soup $5.25
 - 2 stars
 - Soup chowder with rice noodles, shredded fish, and onions, garnished with Fried Yellowbeans and Cilantro
 - This wasn't bad, but it didn't strike me as very inspired.  The sauce was a thick reddish sauce reminiscent in texture of thick Chinese sauces poured over meats and rice.  Sorry, there should be a better explanation but I can't imagine what it is.  The noodles were very very well cooked and watery, almost like pho noodles, only it didn't seem to be the way these noodles were supposed to be.  The taste was subtle...almost too subtle.  Perhaps, tho, I'm being a little harsh because of the great tastes of the other dishes, but really, I wouldn't order this again.

Yamo Cold Noodles $5.25
 - 3.5 stars
 - Cold noodles mixed with house special flavor, onions, cabbage, cucumbers, and chicken
 - Pretty good dish.  The noodles are similar to chow mein noodles but without the glossy oiliness.  This was their spicy dish, but it's more tangy than spicy.  The chicken was covered in a thick, almost dry red sauce with lots of full sized peppers (like the dry peppers found in jars at the table at pizza restaurants).  This dish was also full of different flavors giving a nice complexity to the dish.  I would order this again.

Fresh Coconut $2.50
 - 4 stars
 - All my life, I thought coconuts had a stronger taste because coconut flakes used in cakes had such a strong flavor.  What a surprise to find the taste was so subtle, if you had told me it was a different fruit, I would have believed you.  So light, refreshing.  Loved it.  I also liked that it came in a full coconut rather than a glass.  It was fun to see, and we could scrape the inside for the thicker fruity part of the coconut.    Yeah, I'd order this again, just for the novelty of it.  

Grass Jelly drink $1.00
 - 2.5 stars
 - This is a can drink.  Not carbonated, with bits of jelly in it.  It's similar in taste to Chinese turtle shell gelatin desserts.  I'd drink it again if it was served, but probably wouldn't ever be my first choice.  Still, it tasted like it was probably a healthy drink.

Though we didn't order it, the customer sitting next to us order what I think (just guessing mind you) is the Yamo House Noodles.  That looked really good.  Basically several bite sized pieces of chicken (looking like it was cooked in a thick dark sauce) over a bed of the chow mein like noodles.  It sure as heck looked good.

All in all, this place was pretty good.  If I would have rated it a straight 3.5, I'd got to 4, but given that all the food combined average below a 3.5, I'll have to go with a 3 today.

Except...the price!  The price is so good, that adds a half star right there, pushing the average up and making this place an easy 4 stars.

So with that said, Yay!  I'm a fan!

excerpts: The Tea Salad is FAR superior to Burma Superstar's.
tea salad.author: Wojtek K.
tea salad.review:
Total Hole in the Well, Delicious Food, Intimate,Grimy = 5 Stars.

This place is brilliant -- literally just a long counter w/stools in a tiny, tiny space. 4 Burmese women packed into a tiny kitchen making delicious and super cheap food.

The Tea Salad is FAR superior to Burma Superstar's.  The flavors are beautifully balanced, and the residual heat ads a great touch to the dish.

All other food was very good!  A little low on salt/heat -- but that's the point of the copious chili, sriracha, pickled peppers, and soy sauce in front of you.  Add a little chili oil and some pickled peppers and voila -- delicious.  Beef Curry was phenomenal -- and the Chicken Noodle dish w/ Coconut broth was perfect.  Very gentle flavors -- ready to be attacked with chili oil! YUM!

excerpts: I pretty much *die* for the tea salad.
Yum.
Really can't beat the prices here.
tea salad.author: Cathy L.
tea salad.review: I pretty much *die* for the tea salad.  Yum.  Really can't beat the prices here.

excerpts: Another big thing is the tea salad.
Didn't try it but might next time.
tea salad.author: Judy P.
tea salad.review:
For a hole-in-the-wall place, the food was AWESOME! My two foodie best friends had mentioned this place twice before I actually ventured out to Yamo's with one of them. I must had been the end of lunch hour since it was packed when we got in there. You pretty much have to sit down and grab a seat right away. I ordered the Yamo House Noodles with chicken and it was exactly what I have been craving for a while. I love the type of noodles they used. Barely seen them in other places.  My friend got the chicken coconut noodle soup. Both dishes were very delicious and all for $5.25 each. We also got six samosas for $3.50. 

Another big thing is the tea salad. Didn't try it but might next time. Even though I hate bean sprouts.

Oh, and fresh coconut. Like an actual coconut. 

At these prices, I might be swayed to drive down there more often.

excerpts: The tea salad was delicious, as tea salad always is, but didn't include very many tea leaves which made me sad.
The curry chicken noodles were pretty good.

It's true that they don't give you much curry sauce if you order this to go, but if you put what sauce they do give you into a bowl/container with the noodles and give them a thorough tossing, I found that it was just enough curry sauce to give the noodles a light coating.
I love tea salad!
tea salad.author: Olivia C.
tea salad.review:
I would give Yamo 3.5 stars if I could.  

The tea salad was delicious, as tea salad always is, but didn't include very many tea leaves which made me sad.  The curry chicken noodles were pretty good.  It's true that they don't give you much curry sauce if you order this to go, but if you put what sauce they do give you into a bowl/container with the noodles and give them a thorough tossing, I found that it was just enough curry sauce to give the noodles a light coating.  The mushroom tofu had lots of veggies in it, but was only decent.  All in all, Yamo is not bad and I'd definately come back.  

I love tea salad!

excerpts: I usually order the house special noodles with pork, chicken curry, and the tea salad (with lots of
garlic)..
those are my favs.
I've ordered the fish dishes before and didn't like the cheap tilapia.
The extra garlic and chili available is great!
tea salad.author: Dee S.
tea salad.review:
Good and cheap.

I haven't experienced many Burmese places, but I think Yamo is pretty good for the price.  Yamo is literally a hole-in-the-wall--I love it!  It's small place that can fit about 12 people at their countertop and bar stools. The wait is long when crowded..and when it's not so crowded.  It takes forever to get a dish! There's 1 cook and 1 to 2 women preparing and taking orders.  I suggest ordering take out...they'll say it takes 10-20 minutes, but it's more like 30 or 40 minutes...depending on how much stuff you order and how many people are waiting for their food.

I usually order the house special noodles with pork, chicken curry, and the tea salad (with lots of garlic)..those are my favs.  I've ordered the fish dishes before and didn't like the cheap tilapia.  The extra garlic and chili available is great!

excerpts: The tea salad was a bit too salty for my palate, but maybe it's because I am a whiny hypocondriac trying to avoid symptoms of a class 1 NYHA heart failure patient.
tea salad.author: John L.
tea salad.review:
I've walked back by this hole-in-the-wall several times.  Don't know why my wife and I never came here before.  It might be because of the nice young gentleman hanging out at the corner telling me how to identify my ethnic background in Spanish, but who knows.  He was a such a charming fellow-- so charming that I didn't want to correct him.  "Chino!" he yelled.  I wanted to tell him, "yo soy coreano" but he'd probably give me gift of sputum.  Too generous.

I digress once more.

I went with my wife and a coworker from work.  We ordered the samosas which were pretty good, but needed more texture.  The pot stickers were really good, and we'd definitely give it a go the next time around.  The skin was thick an chewy and the ingrediants inside tasted fresh.  The tea salad was a bit too salty for my palate, but maybe it's because I am a whiny hypocondriac trying to avoid symptoms of a class 1 NYHA heart failure patient.  Nevertheless, it's pretty well prepared.

As the wonderful ladies prepared our meals, my mind started to drift into a euphoria as I saw the care they gave the food.  Or, maybe it was the trace amounts of recycled oil marinating my brain.  Regardless, it was pretty cool.

The house noodles were great!  Chewy, full of flavor, but again, too salty for my taste.  My wife and friend both ordered the fish chowder. My wife let me have some of her's and it was pretty tasty.  I am not too familiar with the cuisine of Burma, (recuerda?  yo soy coreano! --but more like a banana)  I'd describe it as vermicelli/pho noodles in a  corn starch thickened soup with hints of curry and bits of fish.  Not one of my favorites at the time, but it'd be much better if I was super cold and hungry.  
Anyhoo--we'll definitely order out the next time.  The oil still lingers in my limbic system.  We're gonna order the cold noodles, chicken noodle soup, and the pot stickers this weekend.

excerpts: I had the mango salad and he had the fermented tea salad.
Both were excellent.
The mango salad was made with slightly under-ripe mangoes, which were complemented really well by the spicy dressing.
The fermented tea salad is totally bizarre, but delicious, and also had toasted soy nuts (or something) that were salty and yummy.
Best of all - everything on the menu is $5.25 (or cheaper, for the appetizers).
I can't wait to go back.
(But I guess I'll have to.)
tea salad.author: Clare B.
tea salad.review:
What can I say? This place is completely awesome. I only wish I lived about 3,000 miles closer to it.

My friend took me to Yamo when I was visiting S.F. last month. I had the mango salad and he had the fermented tea salad. Both were excellent. The mango salad was made with slightly under-ripe mangoes, which were complemented really well by the spicy dressing. The fermented tea salad is totally bizarre, but delicious, and also had toasted soy nuts (or something) that were salty and yummy. Best of all - everything on the menu is $5.25 (or cheaper, for the appetizers). I can't wait to go back. (But I guess I'll have to.)

excerpts: i had the tea salad and the yamo noodles with beef.
mmm.
the tea salad was a bit spicy but better than burma superstar's.
i loved the noodles.
tender, flavorful beef on top of al dente thick noodles.
tea salad.author: Jonathan K.
tea salad.review:
o! m! g! this is the SMALLEST restaurant i've ever seen! pretty much a bar facing the kitchen. totally divey with poor ventilation. three employees were there this afternoon (early early dinner, around 4:30), one person cooking, one person serving, one person prepping (and all three doing order-taking and what not). 

i had the tea salad and the yamo noodles with beef. mmm. the tea salad was a bit spicy but better than burma superstar's. i loved the noodles. tender, flavorful beef on top of al dente thick noodles. mmm. 

the older ladies are efficient if not a bit surly. at first i was kind of offended, but i think that's just how they are. they sense things. without asking, you will get a box for your leftovers when you're ready, and you'll get your check when you're ready, too. 

definitely will go back, although i'm afraid of crowds, so it's gonna have to be an off-hour visit.

thanks to eileen s. for taking me here!

excerpts: Tea salad was delightful.
Sambusas were decent.
This and the tea salad are driving the rating.
tea salad.author: Riya K.
tea salad.review:
Food = Tea salad was delightful.  Sambusas were decent.  Noodles were standard Chinese restaurant fare.

Ambiance = The little old ladies behind the counter were great.  I would come back just to hang out and pretend they're my own personal grannies.  

Price = Cheeeep.  This and the tea salad are driving the rating.

excerpts: You must order the Tea salad - as Im sure you've gathered from others' reviews.. and if youre with two, well order a couple then.
tea salad.author: Zachary K.
tea salad.review:
Awesome hole in the wall.  No frills, no BS SE Asian food.  Wonderful greasy and cheap cuisine.

You must order the Tea salad - as Im sure you've gathered from others' reviews.. and if youre with two, well order a couple then.

You might wind up waiting for a half hour (at most) outside while you wait - there is only enough space for those already seated, but its totally worth it.

excerpts: Tea salad was okay and house garlic noodles are quick and tasty.
Some of the cheapest edible food in the mission.
Drink from a coconut on your lunch break!!
Do you think they make the apps more expensive than the entrees to deter you from staying too long??!
tea salad.author: Jay P.
tea salad.review:
I think I would come here more often if lunch were not on "the company" account. 

Overview:
Questionably unsanitary...if you are on mission and the area seems to get increasingly sketchy, then you are heading in the right direction for Yamo!  Tea salad was okay and house garlic noodles are quick and tasty.  Some of the cheapest edible food in the mission.  Drink from a coconut on your lunch break!!  Do you think they make the apps more expensive than the entrees to deter you from staying too long??!

excerpts: My brother had the fresh coconut, which I have to get next time when I come back for more tea salad.
Even fullness doesn't stop the craving for Yamo's goodness.
tea salad.author: Pat L.
tea salad.review: Good time.  Had a cold can of sweet grass jelly drink, and enjoyed this cave oasis on a hot saturday at noon, after hustling around the neighborhood in the sun doing my saturday morning biz.  My House Noodles with tofu instead of chicken came lightning-fast.  It was a simple meal and simply perfect.  My brother had the fresh coconut, which I have to get next time when I come back for more tea salad.  Even fullness doesn't stop the craving for Yamo's goodness.

excerpts: The Tea Salad was wilted by the time we got home because it was packed in with the hot dishes.
I would imagine it would have been tasty
had I eaten it there.
tea salad.author: Lisa E.
tea salad.review:
I really wanted to like this place, but the food was too greasy for my liking.  I had the House Noodles with Beef and that's just what it was..Noodles and Beef with a lot of grease.  After managing to blot as much grease off as I could with a paper towel, the beef was actually seasoned well and tasted OK.  My partner had the Curry Chicken over Rice.  No flavor..very bland.  The Tea Salad was wilted by the time we got home because it was packed in with the hot dishes.  I would imagine it would have been tasty had I eaten it there.  We also had the Spring Rolls which were tasty, the peanut sauce was blahhh.

I would recommend take-out as the restaurant is small (5-6 counter seats).  Since the cooking is done on the other side of the counter, I left the restaurant with my take-out in hand smelling like grease.

I give it 3 stars because the women worked hard and the prices were cheap.  I'm willing to give it another try.

excerpts: Make sure to try the tea salad for an unlikely combination of nutty and delicious.
All this with prices so cheap it's silly.
tea salad.author: Raoul D.
tea salad.review:
Ahh...Yamo. The George Webb of San Francisco.

Make sure to try the tea salad for an unlikely combination of nutty and delicious. All this with prices so cheap it's silly.

excerpts: The tea salad is excellent.
Sounds like it won't be, but it is.
Definitely get it.
tea salad.author: Brett J.
tea salad.review:
3.5 stars

What do I like about Yamo?  Well, it is called Yamo.  That's a pretty cool name.  Also, the food is good.  The tea salad is excellent.  Sounds like it won't be, but it is.  Definitely get it.   The curry beef is pretty solid too, and the black bean fish is ok.

The bad? Almost nowhere to sit.  Just ten or so seats at the counter.  Also, if they are cooking something that smells bad when cooking, you have to smell it too because, well, you are right there.  They also don't serve alcohol, which isn't really too big of a deal for me.

If you haven't been here, try it.  I wouldn't say go across town for it, but if you are near here, go here.

excerpts: I recommend the tea salad, coconut chicken soup, and anything with curry and noodles.
tea salad.author: Rachel B.
tea salad.review:
I haven't been this satisfied with a meal since Thanksgiving. 

...Actually this was better than Thanksgiving. Unique (to me) food and super cheap prices make this my new kitchen away from kitchen.  I'm already plotting to go next week. 

I recommend the tea salad, coconut chicken soup, and anything with curry and noodles. 

They also do take-out :)

excerpts: Their creamy Fish Chowder Noodle Soup with fried yellow beans and Tea Salad are definite reasons to return.
tea salad.author: Eva L.
tea salad.review:
I first saw the reviews on Bargain Bites so I thought that I should give it a try.  I didn't know what to expect.

This little family owned Burmese restaurant offers only bar seating for maybe a maximum of approximately ten guests.  Their creamy Fish Chowder Noodle Soup with fried yellow beans and Tea Salad are definite reasons to return.

excerpts: The tea salad wasn't that bad either.
tea salad.author: Van D.
tea salad.review:
It's located smack in between the Mission and the gentrified Valencia. You can see the difference a block makes with the rich on one side and the poor to the other.

Anyways....

I really enjoyed the food here. It's nothing fancy so don't expect to be treated like a superstar. But the ladies here are very nice and try to get to everyone when it's busy. 

The food here is super cheap. Not the best out there but hey, you get what you paid for. Their house noodles are rather greasy but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The tea salad wasn't that bad either. And sodas are just a buck! 

It's a hole in the wall joint that I will be coming back to. I just know it.

excerpts: I get the tea salad almost religiously.
I've been there maybe 25 times and can only remember one occasion where I didn't order the tea salad.
tea salad.author: Mike G.
tea salad.review:
Yamo is amazing, cheap, burmese soul food.  It might seem weird to classify it as such - soul food normally comes from the south, a long way from Burma - but that's how it seems to me.  I go there when I'm feeling a little bluesy, a little empty & in need of something to fill me up.  

I get the tea salad almost religiously.  I've been there maybe 25 times and can only remember one occasion where I didn't order the tea salad.  It is that good - spicy, crunchy, vinegary, amazing.

After that, I've tried everything.  And it's all good.  The noodles and curries tend to the greasy side, but oh-so-delicious.  One exception is the cold noodles, which make a light and delicious alternative to the curries or the other stir-fried dishes.  

Also, try the fish chowder.  Not really all that fishy, but rich and deep in flavor, and topped with crunchy fried beancake chips.  Orgasmic.

excerpts: I went with a friend we had spring rolls which were excellent, samosas which were pretty good, the tea salad (great) and yamo cold noodles.
The noodles were super, spicy, crispy vegtables,  i could not get enough.
tea salad.author: Ashley T.
tea salad.review:
Yamo = YUMo

Don't be intimidated by the surroundings, this place has great food, at an awesome price! Take out seemed to be the choice of most patrons but i enjoyed sitting there watching the women work their magic behind the counter.

I went with a friend we had spring rolls which were excellent, samosas which were pretty good, the tea salad (great) and yamo cold noodles.  The noodles were super, spicy, crispy vegtables,  i could not get enough. I will be back to work my way through the menu. 

the 4 dishes + 2 drinks (non-alcoholic) = $21.... wow.

plus we had leftovers, it was easily enough food for 3, all in all, it was super.

excerpts:
What we ordered:

1-The tea salad was tangy, sweet, and crunchy with a kick of amazing mix of flavors.
tea salad.author: Angelica F.
tea salad.review:
I kinda dig this place! Nothing fancy or hip about it, it's simply a dive restaurant with good food, not amazing, but good.  For me, the experience of watching the group of women go about their business of cooking was great and the tab made it even better. They don't really interact with you, they just get the job done and work their asses off.  Yamo is very tiny, around 7-8 seats and has complementary hooks to hang your coat on the wall, behind your barstool -I like unique touches like that! 

This place has lots of character.  If you want super cheap and OK-good Burmese, but not the best, this is the place.  

Wait time for a seat was aprox 20-30min.  I will probably do take out next time.
 
What we ordered:

1-The tea salad was tangy, sweet, and crunchy with a kick of amazing mix of flavors. It was yummy!

2-The mango chicken was just OK, nothing amazing but not horrible. It was a bit bland for me and lacked flavor.

3-The house noodles were the best of what was ordered. Perfectly cooked, nice balanced flavor and the chicken added was also yummy!  Note: when you order house noodles with meat and want veggies make sure you specifically request with veggies because they don't add unless requested- I need to remember that for next time.

4- Total tab= $19.85  

*CASH ONLY*

excerpts: I recommend the tea salad & coconut soup.
tea salad.author: RYU r.
tea salad.review:
good. cheap. fast. 
I recommend the tea salad & coconut soup.

excerpts: the tea salad is on par with the other burmese places in the city (a good measure for burmese food), although it's portioned more like an appetizer.
tea salad.author: Mark A.
tea salad.review:
it's actually pronounced like yam (the potato)-o

anyway, this is cheap, delicious food made with love.

the tea salad is on par with the other burmese places in the city (a good measure for burmese food), although it's portioned more like an appetizer.

the mango chicken was just all right, but the potstickers and coconut were just amazing.

more importantly, this place is tiny, which means lower rent, which means passing the price on to consumers

excerpts: The  chicken noodle soup and tea salad is my favorite.
tea salad.author: eric m.
tea salad.review:
CHEAP EATS! 
This place is perfect in every way possible. The service is fast the prices are low and the food is excellent.

If you go on a weekday not during lunch peak hour its easy to get a seat. I have never waited more than 10 minutes to be seated. IF you come in the weekend or dinner be ready to wait. Just saying.
The  chicken noodle soup and tea salad is my favorite.

excerpts: The tea salad is quite tasty, but this place is a little too chaotic for me to handle on a regular basis.
Everyone once and a while this is worth it for two things: the tea salad and the chicken noodle soup.
The salad is nicely balanced with lots of crunchy bits like peanuts and fried garlic to keep things interesting.
The chicken soup has a rich and hearty broth with coconut milk.
The rest of the menu is not very memorable.
tea salad.author: Matt B.
tea salad.review:
The tea salad is quite tasty, but this place is a little too chaotic for me to handle on a regular basis.

Takeout is a challenge here: ordering by phone connects you directly into the noisy kitchen, so there is a lot of "huh?" and "what?" before the order is done. The staff doesn't take down a name or a phone number, so when you arrive to pick up, you need to dictate your order again, this time yelling over the counter.

Everyone once and a while this is worth it for two things: the tea salad and the chicken noodle soup. The salad is nicely balanced with lots of crunchy bits like peanuts and fried garlic to keep things interesting. The chicken soup has a rich and hearty broth with coconut milk. The rest of the menu is not very memorable.

excerpts: and the tea salad which was also ok and the tofu veggie curry noodles which didn't really taste of curry at all.
However the price was really great and the hole in the wall ambiance was really feeling the vibe.
Plans for next time, curry beef (I was wearing a white shirt and pastelly jacket
so sensibly avoided it this time), mango salad and the spring rolls.
tea salad.author: Gwyneth T.
tea salad.review: Went with friends so I thought it would be difficult to get seated but we managed to get 2 stools after a 10 minute wait and then another stool a few minutes later.  Ordered the house noodles with chicken which was ok and the tea salad which was also ok and the tofu veggie curry noodles which didn't really taste of curry at all.  However the price was really great and the hole in the wall ambiance was really feeling the vibe.  Plans for next time, curry beef (I was wearing a white shirt and pastelly jacket so sensibly avoided it this time), mango salad and the spring rolls.

excerpts: Curiosity grew and finally I opened the door to have: freshly prepared delicious spring rolls, a great tea salad and a fresh and balanced mango chicken.
The entire meal was 14 dollars, 7 bucks each! "
Bargain bite" is not fair, this is lovely food at its price.
tea salad.author: Dario B.
tea salad.review: If you ride the 33 you cannot help having a glimpse at this hole in the wall and its cute door decor. Curiosity grew and finally I opened the door to have: freshly prepared delicious spring rolls, a great tea salad and a fresh and balanced mango chicken. The entire meal was 14 dollars, 7 bucks each! "Bargain bite" is not fair, this is lovely food at its price. On top of this, which is largely enough, the place is family owned and run entirely by women....big up!

excerpts: My favs include the cold house noodles, tea salad, fish chowder, curry,
OK its all good!
tea salad.author: Libby R.
tea salad.review:
One of my go-to spots, quick, cheep, and absolutely delicious!   Tiny place with only a dozen seats at a counter, there may be a wait but it's well worth it, and the turn over is quick.  Or just call in and take it to go.

My favs include the cold house noodles, tea salad, fish chowder, curry,  OK its all good!

excerpts: Oh, you spicy delicious tea salad.
You tempt my mouth even now.
Not even Burma Superstar's can compare to you.
I swear it (even as I cower from the audacity of my own words)!
Please tell your owners not to be closed on Sundays.
Having watched them work their asses off to cook my last meal, I know they deserve the day off, but still.
I am lost without you.
Thank you for also being cheap.
tea salad.author: Tracy D.
tea salad.review: Oh, you spicy delicious tea salad. You tempt my mouth even now. Not even Burma Superstar's can compare to you. I swear it (even as I cower from the audacity of my own words)! Please tell your owners not to be closed on Sundays. Having watched them work their asses off to cook my last meal, I know they deserve the day off, but still. I am lost without you. Thank you for also being cheap.

excerpts: I didn't try the tea salad, but heard good things from other patrons.
I plan on revisiting this nifty little spot on 18th street.
tea salad.author: Anjali K.
tea salad.review: Definitely order #15 with your choice of beef, chicken or shrimp.  I had the beef, but don't think you can go wrong any which way.  The noodles were delicious.  One bowl was definitely enough food for 1 person and in my opinion is shareable.  The food was cheap and just plain tasty.  I didn't try the tea salad, but heard good things from other patrons.  I plan on revisiting this nifty little spot on 18th street.  Stop in and saddle up to a bar stool and have a bowl of noodles - you won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Arrive early, try the tea salad, and watch this cadre of tiny sisters bicker adorably!
Fun, quick (once youre seated) and inexpensive.
tea salad.author: M S.
tea salad.review: Arrive early, try the tea salad, and watch this cadre of tiny sisters bicker adorably! Fun, quick (once youre seated) and inexpensive.

excerpts: I personally recco the yamo house noodles with pork and the tea salad.
tea salad.author: Jake H.
tea salad.review: this is actually like a 4.5.  It's great...it's my new neighborhood place.  I shouldn't even write a review...there is already a line out the door.  My only drawback is that they have such a limited menu.  There's alot of overlap on tastes.  They have a menu of about 15 things and apparently they are all good.  I personally recco the yamo house noodles with pork and the tea salad.  Note that they close at 9:30 and up till that point there will be (as I said) a line out the door.  This place is no longer hidden, I'm just being a flurry on Yelp

excerpts: The tea salad didn't live up to others I have had.
The brightness of flavors wasn't there - it was more spicy than anything.
Food was good overall
and I will return when I am in the area.
I'd like to give them 3.5 stars.
tea salad.author: T-Bone L.
tea salad.review: The tea salad didn't live up to others I have had.  The brightness of flavors wasn't there - it was more spicy than anything.  Food was good overall and I will return when I am in the area.  I'd like to give them 3.5 stars.

excerpts: we tried the tea salad today and the fried garlic was so delicious!
tea salad.author: Melanie C.
tea salad.review:
went with danny e. and melissa (right below me). delicious noodles, small space though, as there are only about 8 stools at the counter. danny and i went today and we had that type of meal where the food is so good, that you just don't talk to the person you are with because you are too busy stuffing your face with delicious egg noodle goodness. we tried the tea salad today and the fried garlic was so delicious! 

love the old ladies that work here and we ESPECIALLY love it when they are whacking away with a machete (not really, just a big ol' knife but machete is so much more fun to say!) at the coconut just to give you coconut milk to drink. the food comes fairly quick and it's super cheap too, i've gotten the yamo house noodles with pork both times i've been here and they give you so much meat for $5.95. bottom line is, yamo gives you a good feeling in the tum after eating.

excerpts: Try the tea salad and the tofu with mushrooms.
tea salad.author: Christopher V.
tea salad.review: Inexpensive and delicious.  The cramped, hot space adds to the atmosphere, much liked Tu Lan or Cordon Bleu, but even smaller and even more cramped.  I'm lying here smelling grease on my clothes but I'm still writing a 5-star review.  Well, let's make it 4.   Try the tea salad and the tofu with mushrooms.

excerpts: I love their prawn curry over noodles, mango chicken noodles, the yamo house noodles, veg curry, samosas, tea salad.
That's what I had so far.
I'm going to try everything on the menu.
It's also inexpensive too.
Parking is okay....
tea salad.author: Miyoko N.
tea salad.review: This place is super Burmese!  I love their prawn curry over noodles, mango chicken noodles, the yamo house noodles, veg curry, samosas, tea salad. That's what I had so far.  I'm going to try everything on the menu.  It's also inexpensive too.  Parking is okay....

excerpts: the tea salad is definitely the standout dish, i order it every time i go there.
with all its little crunchy, nutty surprises i could probably eat a few pounds of it before my mouth got bored.
tea salad.author: pizzazz g.
tea salad.review:
i found yamo accidentally, cruising up mission to country station. i had never even noticed it before, but there it was, a ghostly apparition. it was a hole in the wall for sure, and i immediately felt like i was back in asia, where food is cheap, well seasoned, and satisfying. the tea salad is definitely the standout dish, i order it every time i go there. with all its little crunchy, nutty surprises i could probably eat a few pounds of it before my mouth got bored. follow that with a sweet fresh coconut and you are good to go.

the ladies who work there are friendly and pretty fast. i've gotten there when it was full and thought, "oh, shit. this will take forever," but i've never had a really long wait like you would at the superstar. plus it's in my hood! and really, it is such a deal, you could order several dishes and totally pig out for less than $20. for two people! it's probably not for everyone, and it's definitely not gourmet, but it is good cheap eats.

excerpts: The noodles are nicely al-dente and the tea salad is tasty.
Shame they don't have a liquor license though, the onion, garlic and especially salt is a bit overpowering - definitely needs a beerish companion!
tea salad.author: Will A.
tea salad.review: Yamo is a great change of pace from the regular old sit-down restaurant. It's a narrow, busy, comfy little place very reminiscent of the restaurants you find in cities around Asia. The noodles are nicely al-dente and the tea salad is tasty. Shame they don't have a liquor license though, the onion, garlic and especially salt is a bit overpowering - definitely needs a beerish companion!

excerpts: People seem to like the tea salad, but it's a little lackluster for my tastes.
At any rate, I love the counter-only setup, although packed quarters with the kitchen right in my lap always leaves my clothes smelling smoky when I leave.
tea salad.author: Calvin L.
tea salad.review: $5.25 for anything noodle dish on the menu? Sweet! The house noodles are good, and the cold noodles are GREAT. People seem to like the tea salad, but it's a little lackluster for my tastes. At any rate, I love the counter-only setup, although packed quarters with the kitchen right in my lap always leaves my clothes smelling smoky when I leave.

excerpts: We had the house special noodles w/ chicken, curry prawns w/ noodles, and tea salad.
All the food was good, but the flavors were simple, lacking any distinctive deliciousness, thus forcing me to apply the hotcock.
However, Yamo is incredibly charming
and I will always have a soft spot in my heart for little hole-in-the-wall family places.
it hurts me to give this place only 3 stars, and honestly I would go back, but the food really does not deserve 4.
tea salad.author: greg B.
tea salad.review: I had lunch at Yamo today, and to be honest, I was a little dissapointed.  We had the house special noodles w/ chicken, curry prawns w/ noodles, and tea salad.  All the food was good, but the flavors were simple, lacking any distinctive deliciousness, thus forcing me to apply the hotcock.  However, Yamo is incredibly charming and I will always have a soft spot in my heart for little hole-in-the-wall family places.  it hurts me to give this place only 3 stars, and honestly I would go back, but the food really does not deserve 4.

excerpts: The tea salad.
tea salad.author: Ali W.
tea salad.review:
The fish chowder. 

The coconuts.

The tea salad.

The Burma perms.

AWESOME.

excerpts: the tea salad is amazing, as are the spring rolls.
tea salad.author: Gina M.
tea salad.review:
i wish someone would tell the people at yamo that they could probably charge more for their delicious food and people would still pay for it --- yamo's food is beyond cheap.  i worry that the fantastic people at yamo aren't making what they deserve... 

the tea salad is amazing, as are the spring rolls.

excerpts: Tea Salad is fantastic.
Mango Chicken not special but still great for the price.
Love sitting at the bench and you get to watch them cook.
Worth every cent.
tea salad.author: Matt S.
tea salad.review: First time in San Fran.  Tea Salad is fantastic.  Mango Chicken not special but still great for the price.  Love sitting at the bench and you get to watch them cook. Worth every cent.

excerpts: We ordered the mango salad, tea salad, and vegetable curry.
We were handed our food and left without checking that it was the right dishes.
We got home and discovered that we got both salads, but we got the vegetable stir fry instead, and she threw in and charged us for spring roles, which we didn't order.
the salads were tasty, but they kind of made my stomach hurt, and the vegetable stirfry was nasty, fried, watery, oily, yuck.
All in all if I'm looking for some cheap eats I would not go back to this place, or at least I wouldn't order take out.
tea salad.author: Malcolm K.
tea salad.review: we ordered and I asked how long it would be and the old woman who yells instead of talks said it would be 15 min.  We went and had a beer and came back about 20 min later and it wasn't ready.  I figured I'd asked the young helper what was up since she probably spoke better english, and she said (in broken english)... "Wait on vegetable's".  We didn't mind the wait since it was a nice night out and we'd had a beer.  We ordered the mango salad, tea salad, and vegetable curry.  We were handed our food and left without checking that it was the right dishes.  We got home and discovered that we got both salads, but we got the vegetable stir fry instead, and she threw in and charged us for spring roles, which we didn't order. the salads were tasty, but they kind of made my stomach hurt, and the vegetable stirfry was nasty, fried, watery, oily, yuck.  All in all if I'm looking for some cheap eats I would not go back to this place, or at least I wouldn't order take out.

excerpts: We asked for the tea salad, fish chowder noodle soup, and yamo house noodles.
fish chowder noodle soup.author: Justin C.
fish chowder noodle soup.review:
I was told that this place had good, cheap food, but the people working there didn't speak English. I came by with my friends twice but there was a wait so we decided to come back the next day at 2pm... there was still a wait. After ten or so mins, the ladies working asked us what we wanted (in English) and were pretty friendly. So we put in our orders while we were still waiting which is pretty efficient of them. We asked for the tea salad, fish chowder noodle soup, and yamo house noodles. Each dish was $6.50. 

The only dish that stood out to me was the tea leaf salad. It was very fragrant. It's hard to describe but had two types of crunchiness one from some fried beans and some from the cabbage. The salad was slightly sweet, incredibly spicy but not too bad. There was a slight herbaciousness and had smokey Jasmine flavors. I really enjoyed this dish so extra stars for that. The others... not so much. I thought the house noodles were a bit bland but my friend really liked them. I remember it being a little light on the protein. The fish chowder soup had a weird flavor that I didn't quite enjoy nor could I place what was off about it. It was topped with some kind of crispy crackers? There was no actual fish in this dish. I wouldn't order this again

In all a pretty enjoyable experience but I wouldn't want to wait more than 10 mins for it... It really depends on how fast the people eat because this place is TINY. Hardly any space between the barline counter and the wall to exit the restaurant.

excerpts:
PROS: 
- good food (got the house special with pork, fish chowder noodle soup, and
I definitely liked how unique the fish chowder noodle soup was, never tasted anything like it.
The house special noodles with pork tasted like typical garlic chow mein noodles, though the pork was bomb.
fish chowder noodle soup.author: Raquel Y.
fish chowder noodle soup.review:
PROS: 
- good food (got the house special with pork, fish chowder noodle soup, and tea salad) 
- CHEAP food (everything was $6.75....WTF) 
- authentic 

CONS:
- rude Asian lady (but I'm sure she doesn't mean to be rude. That's just their culture)
- cash only 

The space is extremely small that can probably only seat like 11 people. I didn't know if it was a pro or con, because pro it gives it the Asian atmosphere of small hole-in-the-wall authentic restaurant, and con because well, it's tiny af. Hence, a wait. 

All the food was good and cheap though. I definitely liked how unique the fish chowder noodle soup was, never tasted anything like it. The house special noodles with pork tasted like typical garlic chow mein noodles, though the pork was bomb. And tea salad was tasty with a kick to it. 

If there's a long wait, probably best to get to go. And don't get offended if the Asian lady yells at you! That's just how she normally talks lol.

excerpts: Mohinga (Fish Chowder Noodle Soup) isn't even that good.
Burma Superstar is much much better!
fish chowder noodle soup.author: Nicholas N.
fish chowder noodle soup.review:
Horrible service. I initially ordered to go and already paid and tipped. After seats opened up, I asked the chef if I can eat inside and she said yes. Apparently I asked the wrong person as I was given the to go containers by the other lady and when asked if I can sit and eat, I was told to leave as I ordered to go. The chef then asked to confirm if I already paid, and when I said yes, she suggested nicely for me to leave too. I wished I took back my tip. Same lady that told me to leave doesn't wash her hands after touching cash (cash only) and can be seen using hands to prepare the noodles... Attention San Francisco Department of Public Health.

Mohinga (Fish Chowder Noodle Soup) isn't even that good. Burma Superstar is much much better!

excerpts: The Yamo Cold Noodles and Fish Chowder Noodle Soup had visually stimulating color palette and great flavor!
The fish chowder could have used a little more fish, because I was fishing for fish the whole time, but I really liked the broth!
The people who were eating Garlic Noodles next to me made me want to get that next time.
fish chowder noodle soup.author: Shelley C.
fish chowder noodle soup.review:
The Yamo Cold Noodles and Fish Chowder Noodle Soup had visually stimulating color palette and great flavor! The fish chowder could have used a little more fish, because I was fishing for fish the whole time, but I really liked the broth! The people who were eating Garlic Noodles next to me made me want to get that next time. The ladies who run this place may seem stand-offish to others, but once you get over that, it's just a bit hilarious the wacky things they say and do. 

Customer next to me: " Can I have another plate to share this bowl of food?" 
Yamo lady: "No, you already have bowl."

Yamo lady *cutting carrots with her back to me*
Me *taking pictures of my surroundings*
Yamo lady without turning "No pictures."

Customer 2: "Can I have some water."
Yamo lady: "No water, only bottled water, $2."

excerpts: Ordered their Tea salad (of course), yamo house noodles with pork, fish chowder noodle soup, and black bean fish for our group of 3.
Yamo House noodles with pork was really simple.
Just noodles with stir fried pork.
There wasn't too much seasoning that I could see, but it was still rather tasty.
Fish chowder noodle soup was probably my favorite.
I don't know what was the crispy bit of the soup was, but it created a great texture contrast to the soup, which I loved.
The black bean fish dish was probably my least favorite of the 4.
It was good, but I think I'm used to the black beans not being so strong.
fish chowder noodle soup.author: Mai K.
fish chowder noodle soup.review:
This is how my visit to Yamo went down. 

Friend: Their Tea salad is great. Definitely recommend. 
Me: Out of all their items, you recommend a salad? 
Friend: It's really good.
