excerpts: We got the tea leaf salad, house noodle, curry fish and mango chicken for two.
Portions were great for the price.
However the curry fish and house noodle both tasted like they added at least 1/2 cup vegetable oil to each dish.
The mango chicken is less greasy
curry fish.author: Christine C.
curry fish.review:
We came here because we love Burmese food, but apart from the tea leaf salad (which i will give a 4 star for), everything else was just below-par at most 2-star greasy Chinese/Cantonese street food. 

We got the tea leaf salad, house noodle, curry fish and mango chicken for two. Portions were great for the price. However the curry fish and house noodle both tasted like they added at least 1/2 cup vegetable oil to each dish. The mango chicken is less greasy but I did not manage to taste mango apart from the few canned mango pieces (which honestly did not taste like mango neither) floating around.

What really triggered me to give it a 1 star is the hygiene of the restaurant. OMG the lady shredding onions next to me had no gloves, wore a super dirty apron, sneezed all the time, wiped her nose with her bare hand, and continued to cut onions with the same hand... I later realized that there was raw onions in the tea leaf salad and that was not easy to get over it.

The ventilation of the whole place is also extremely poor. My coat smelt like grease after I sat inside for 30 mins.

Bottom line: will not come back again.

excerpts:
Between the 4 of us we got 2 orders of samosas, a tea leaf salad, mango chicken, house noodles w/chicken, chicken curry w/noodles, and curry fish w/noodles. 

I didn't try the mango chicken or the curry fish, but my friends seemed to enjoy them!
curry fish.author: Natasha H.
curry fish.review:
This place is dirty and super small. The only seating is a counter with about 10 stools. And three loud, gruff Chinese women cook all the food and operate the place.

 But...I LOVE IT!

I came here a few weeks ago with 3 other friends and we squeezed into the remaining 4 seats at the counter. Food was good,cheap, and greasy!! Between the 4 of us we got 2 orders of samosas, a tea leaf salad, mango chicken, house noodles w/chicken, chicken curry w/noodles, and curry fish w/noodles. 

And all of this was only about $35! My first thought was "WTF?! Am I still in SF?!" It's almost impossible to find prices like this in this city...and they don't skimp on their portions either!!

As for the food, the samosas and tea leaf salad were on the spicy side, but very tasty. And the chicken curry and house noodles were rolling in grease, but so delicious nonetheless. I didn't try the mango chicken or the curry fish, but my friends seemed to enjoy them! 

Sure this place is ghetto and hole-in-wall, but that's why there's take out. Plus, I really didn't mind the ghetto surroundings when food was so good and at such devilishly low prices! When we left, with our tummies full of good food, there was a line forming outside...and it was raining too. That can only be an indicator of good things. 

Yah, I want some Mo'!  4 Stars!

excerpts: We tried the curry fish which was really a gut bomb (in the best way possible).
It was pretty oily but
in a good way an exactly what I was craving at that moment.
Everything was seasoned nicely and it tasted great.
The tea leaf salad was also excellent and very different than anything I've tasted before.
curry fish.author: Jordan B.
curry fish.review:
Yamo by far was one of my favorite dining experiences that I have ever had.

I came here on a recommendation from a friend. My partner and I were lucky as we came after the lunch rush. This place is small and I loved it. It's more of a hallway and there is only bar seating where 3-4 women work harder than I've ever worked in my life. When I read reviews from people saying the service was rude, I just sort of chalked it up tot he fact that they've probably never worked a service/serving job. My order was put in correctly, she was fast, and was just pleasant enough. I think in this particular setting I would have been put off if she was sugary sweet. 

This isn't a restaurant; it's a dining experience. 

My partner and I shared a few dishes. Most of what we ate were recommendations from Yelp and we weren't set astray. It was all pretty excellent (and quite different than anything I've had before).

We tried the curry fish which was really a gut bomb (in the best way possible). It was pretty oily but in a good way an exactly what I was craving at that moment. Everything was seasoned nicely and it tasted great. The tea leaf salad was also excellent and very different than anything I've tasted before. I'm sort of trying to reach for adjectives other than "good" but am coming up blank, so I'm sorry. Just get it :)

My prescription for after you eat Yamo? a solid 45 min to an hour nap.

Oh and the prices were great. We got four large dishes and our check was something like $22. Yes.

excerpts: Ordered the curry fish over noodles and house noodle with chicken, which is BOMB.
Not great service
but they remind you of Asian moms
so it's homey and provides great entertainment.
Dishes are about 6 bucks per plate
curry fish.author: Jeffrey S.
curry fish.review:
Hole in the wall with old asian ladies screaming in the background. It literally has maybe 10 seats on along a counter and the kitchen is tiny. Can get packed super fast but it doesn't take too long to order take out.

Ordered the curry fish over noodles and house noodle with chicken, which is BOMB. Not great service but they remind you of Asian moms so it's homey and provides great entertainment. Dishes are about 6 bucks per plate so it's definitely wallet friendly.

Awesome food, good portions and great price!

excerpts: Next time I'll have to try the curry fish with rice and the Yamo house noodles with beef.
And get a tea leaf salad just for my gluttonous myself.
This is going to be a fat summer, but at least it will be a cheap and spicy one.
curry fish.author: Liz T.
curry fish.review:
Small, smoky, stools-only... It was love at first sight. I wish I lived in the Mission--I could have bacon donuts for breakfast, super burritos for lunch, and this incredible Burmese stuff for dinner. I would eventually grow out of everything I presently own, but what's a few inches and several pounds? TOTALLY. WORTH. THEM.

My friend and I shared the spring rolls ($3.60), the tea leaf salad ($5.25), the black bean fish with wide rice noodles ($5.25), and the Yamo cold noodles with chicken ($5.25).  We had a satisfying meal of four dishes for a just over $21! Insane for SF!

The rolls were made fresh and super refreshing--good because you're in a bathroom-sized restaurant with a hot kitchen before you. The tea leaf salad was small but scrumptious--I just love the textural contrast of the many ingredients. The fish was lightly fried and really tasty, but the rice noodles were a bit bland. The cold noodles were chewy and flavorful, but the chicken was rather dry. Next time I'll have to try the curry fish with rice and the Yamo house noodles with beef. And get a tea leaf salad just for my gluttonous myself. This is going to be a fat summer, but at least it will be a cheap and spicy one. Everything was mildly spicy except the rolls.

I wasn't crazy about Burmese food after Burma Superstar, after Mandalay, after Burmese Kitchen, but I am definitely a fan after Yamo. The food is so homey and delicious, the Asian ladies are so hard-working and sweet--I can't help but just adore this hole-in-the-wall. 

Although I ate here last night, in anticipation of eating here a lot, I will begin accepting dinner dates here for the rest of the summer starting right now. Don't all flood my inbox at once.

excerpts: Curry fish was good.
curry fish.author: Nam T.
curry fish.review:
I always wanted to try this place but there's always a line. Forget about trying to go to dinner here if you're hungry. During the day it's not so bad. I've been here a few times for Saturday lunch and it is super quiet. 

The salads and the main dishes are $6 and it's decent. There's nothing really special. The tea salad is good and has a nice crunch to it. Mango chicken with rice is a little dry. Curry fish was good. I like the noodles because on a hot day, all you want is some cold noodles. 

Don't expect good service (which I appreciate the loud sassiness of the ladies) or sanitary. Burmese food seem similiar to most SE Asian food so nothing spectacular that there need to be a huge line for. When you're broke, hungry and don't feel like eating Mexican, this is a good alternative place...if u can get in.

excerpts: Skip the curry fish.
Expect to sit down and order quickly as there are only 8 seats or so.
The cooks are on a mission so don't expect smiles or courtesies like that.
Cash only - really well priced.
I'd definitely come back!
curry fish.author: Charlene N.
curry fish.review: Delicious house noodles and tea salad. Skip the curry fish. Expect to sit down and order quickly as there are only 8 seats or so. The cooks are on a mission so don't expect smiles or courtesies like that. Cash only - really well priced. I'd definitely come back!

excerpts: We ordered the samusas  (this is how they were spelled on the menu), pot stickers, tea salad, and the curry fish.
curry fish.author: V R.
curry fish.review:
Visited for the 1st time last night and was pleasantly shocked how much I enjoyed it.  

Its tiny, only about a dozen seats at the counter and so I can imagine on a busy night there is fair wait, but we waited only about 10 min.  We ordered the samusas  (this is how they were spelled on the menu), pot stickers, tea salad, and the curry fish. Everything was super tasty and the bill came to whopping $20 and change, not bad at all!

Take-out seemed to be a popular option, which makes sense giving the limited seating. Honestly the only reasons I'm not giving it a 5 star is 1. No alcohol... a beer would have been great with that meal and 2. We came at the end of service and do to the limited space the staff was chopping up large volumes of onions next us in prep for the next day which was making my eyes water.  But let me just say, a little eye watering wouldn't deter me from going back!

excerpts: I wasn't a fan of the curry fish - very salty, even when mixed with rice and/or noodles, and not appetizing.
curry fish.author: Shikha K.
curry fish.review:
You want hole-in-the-wall? This place has you covered. It is 10 seats max, and if it's at capacity (which it nearly always is), it is crowded. Be prepared to bump elbows with your neighbor, and don't bring in too many bags/jackets, as that takes up the aisle space well.

Space aside, the food is good and extremely affordable. Their salads are a must - tea leaf and mango are awesome and the best things I ate there. Chow fun noodles are good with veggies, but I like my food spicy so I added a lot of chili sauce on them. I wasn't a fan of the curry fish - very salty, even when mixed with rice and/or noodles, and not appetizing.

Overall, you get a bang for your buck (my four dishes cost me $24 and I was suitably full). This is a no-frills place, so don't expect much in terms of service or space, and come early (before 8pm), to avoid a long wait.

excerpts: The curry fish however, was a disappointment, because it tasted nothing like curry.
Overall I think it'd be a good place to grab a quick bite or especially take out.
curry fish.author: Lucy X.
curry fish.review: After a friend raved about eating really good Burmese food in SF, I looked up the best Burmese joint and ventured out late one night to try it. They were near closing and still had a full house, or rather bar because the place only had about 8 or so seats in total. So we still had to wait what seemed quite a long time. As we took our seat, more people kept coming but the owner wouldn't let them in (this was about 30 min to closing time). Even though I wasn't particularly hungry, I still could finish the tea leaf salad and house noodles because they were pretty tasty, especially the noodles. The curry fish however, was a disappointment, because it tasted nothing like curry. Overall I think it'd be a good place to grab a quick bite or especially take out.

excerpts: Walked in ordered the tea salad( or cabbage slaw because thats all it really was) the house noodles and the curry fish.
My girlfriend decided to take a picture of the food in front of us and the owner yelled at us " wat du
yu not undestand no piktures!"
First of all there are no signs posted saying no pictures, secondly, you never warned us a first time.
This made the whole experience the worst experience I've ever had in a food establishment.
Dont remember if the food was bland because I was angry or because it did not have flavor, a bit of both perhaps.
And for that I will never come back to this little Rat hole in the wall (
i wouldn'd be surprised if a colony of rats live their)...
curry fish.author: chris B.
curry fish.review: Came to this place for lunch with my girlfriend after looking for a unique place to eat in the city. What a HORRIBLE mistake. Walked in ordered the tea salad( or cabbage slaw because thats all it really was) the house noodles and the curry fish. My girlfriend decided to take a picture of the food in front of us and the owner yelled at us " wat du yu not undestand no piktures!"...... First of all there are no signs posted saying no pictures, secondly, you never warned us a first time. This made the whole experience the worst experience I've ever had in a food establishment.Dont remember if the food was bland because I was angry or because it did not have flavor, a bit of both perhaps. And for that I will never come back to this little Rat hole in the wall ( i wouldn'd be surprised if a colony of rats live their)...

excerpts: I've also tried the Curry Fish, which is great (yet not as amazing as the aforementioned dish).
curry fish.author: Emille L.
curry fish.review:
House Noodles with Beef all day, everyday.

I've also tried the Curry Fish, which is great (yet not as amazing as the aforementioned dish).

Cheap, cheap, cheap everything!

If you aren't put off by a cramped and hot eating area (one counter that seats about 10), *ahem* a less than spotless cooking area, billowing smoke from a wok, and a healthy amount of grease (hey, I don't eat here everyday), Yamo is for you!  If divey, hole in the wall Burmese is not your deal, go to Mandalay Restaurant on Clement for Burmese.

excerpts: My friends and I shared samusas, the tea salad, and we each got our own entree dish (I got the curry fish with noodles)
Samusas were great, well seasoned with enough kick to give your tongue a tickle.
Tea salad was great too--a lot like the "tea leaf salads" you get at other Burmese restaurants, but this place is a bit more authentic.

Tea leaf salads traditionally are made with cabbage (which this one was)... but at most establishments like Burma Superstar or Pagan, they use romaine lettuce since we Americans eat more romaine than cabbage.
Curry fish was OK, but my friends who got the curry chicken and mango chicken loved theirs.
The curry fish, which had batter around it, wasn't deep-fried, but instead was panfriend, a lot like how my mom cooks it.
I would have preferred it to be deep-fried, that way the fish is a lot crispier. .
.so
instead, everytime I ate each bite of fish, it was like chewing into something kinda soggy...
curry fish.author: Matthew L.
curry fish.review:
What an interesting establishment!  

It was like going to a diner, but instead serving Chinese/Burmese food.  The food was pretty tasty, although on a little on the greasy side...but hey, that's restaurant food.  My friends and I shared samusas, the tea salad, and we each got our own entree dish (I got the curry fish with noodles)  Samusas were great, well seasoned with enough kick to give your tongue a tickle.  Tea salad was great too--a lot like the "tea leaf salads" you get at other Burmese restaurants, but this place is a bit more authentic.  Tea leaf salads traditionally are made with cabbage (which this one was)... but at most establishments like Burma Superstar or Pagan, they use romaine lettuce since we Americans eat more romaine than cabbage.  Curry fish was OK, but my friends who got the curry chicken and mango chicken loved theirs.  The curry fish, which had batter around it, wasn't deep-fried, but instead was panfriend, a lot like how my mom cooks it.  I would have preferred it to be deep-fried, that way the fish is a lot crispier. . .so instead, everytime I ate each bite of fish, it was like chewing into something kinda soggy...so that didn't sit too well on my palate, despite the good flavor.

Pricing of this food is really cheap--the appetizers are like $3.25 and entrees are like $5.25.  So you definitely get full way fast at such a low price.

The place is opened by 3 Chinese ladies.  Me being Chinese I couldn't help but listen in on their conversations.  I found their conversations to be quite entertaining!

Since this place only seats about 8-10 people, there is usually a line out ther door.  Last night, when my friends and I went...it was raining, but fortunately when we had gotten in, there were 4 seats for all of us.  There really isn't a "prime time" for eating dinner, since it's pretty crowded during all hours of dinner time.

excerpts: I had the curry fish and it was SO GOOD, but very greasy.
The curry is actually spicy!
Make sure you pick the noodles, not the rice!
The mango salad was also amazing, the flavors were just right.
My boyfriend had the mango chicken and that was also really good.
curry fish.author: Vivian H.
curry fish.review:
There are about a total of 8 stools in this place.  You sit at the counter and watch the two ladies cook your food.  There is a very good chance that you will smell like grease afterwards.

The food is amazing cheap.  Everything is 5.25 and 3.50 for the appetizers.  However, portions aren't that huge and the bulk of it are noodles or rice.  I had the curry fish and it was SO GOOD, but very greasy.  The curry is actually spicy!  Make sure you pick the noodles, not the rice!  The mango salad was also amazing, the flavors were just right.  My boyfriend had the mango chicken and that was also really good.  The SAMUSAS are great!!  Very flavorful!  It puts other samusas to shame.  

And.. no tax?!!!

excerpts:
We got the,

tea leaf salad - really good and definitely different from Burma Superstar
Potstickers - didnt try (pork) but I dont think it was that good because they were not wiped out
Curry Shrimp with Noodles
Curry Fish with Noodles
Chicken Yamo - to go
curry fish.author: Sapna E.
curry fish.review:
How awesome is this place. Your typical divey joint, with two screaming women, shouting your order. By the end of your meal you are definitely slightly deaf and also smell like you bathed in some burmese food :)

The only seating option is the bar and you have to wait maybe ~20minutes. But its definitely worth it.

We were four, and sat initially as twosomes separately and then as people got up to leave, we scooted to sit altogether. 

We got the,

tea leaf salad - really good and definitely different from Burma Superstar
Potstickers - didnt try (pork) but I dont think it was that good because they were not wiped out
Curry Shrimp with Noodles
Curry Fish with Noodles
Chicken Yamo - to go
Stir Fry Vegetable with Rice


super cheap and really good food! perfect for a low key evening. Also, vry popular as a "to-go" option. As expected, this is a cash-only joint!

excerpts: Our group had the Tea Leaf Salad, Cold Chicken Yamo Noodles and the Curry Fish dish.
All were excellent.
The Yamo Noodles were extremely simple in a sauce with a nice kick to it.
The Curry Fish has a textured sweetness that reminded me of French Toast.
curry fish.author: Matt L.
curry fish.review:
I really enjoyed Yamo.  First Yamo is extremely small and seats only about 10 people.  It is also not a place you should expect fancy-smancy decor.  While it is basic, the food is terrific and tasty at a great value.  

Our group had the Tea Leaf Salad, Cold Chicken Yamo Noodles and the Curry Fish dish.  All were excellent.  The Yamo Noodles were extremely simple in a sauce with a nice kick to it.  The Curry Fish has a textured sweetness that reminded me of French Toast.  While I did not try the Tea Leaf, our friend enjoy the flavor.  

We lucked out and got their early on a holiday weekend Friday.  There is not much room and their can be a long wait.  If you are looking for something different from your Thai or Chinese, you should absolutely try Burmese at Yamo!

excerpts: Will be back to try their Crispy Egg Rolls and Curry Fish!
curry fish.author: Sassy G.
curry fish.review:
Spring Roll (not the deep fried ones but the soft rolls): Good but I've had better elsewhere. Like more mint in mines.

Tea Leaf Salad: Crunchy!  All ingredients FRESH. Excellent!! Better than Burma Star.

House Noodle (Pork): Meat seared perfectly. Noodle consistency is chewy but not hard.

Cold Noodle: Same noodle as the House Noodle but mixed in with lettuce, carrots, cucumber, cilantro, onion. You mix it all together and it's almost like having noodle salad. Tip: to give it a kick, add jalapeno and vinegar (part of the condiment on the counter where you sit)  into this dish.  

Fresh Coconut Juice: Drink it straight from the coconut shell. Freakin' awesome.

Portions on the small side just like in all parts of Asia (except the Cold Noodle. That was a tad bigger).  

Total cost:  approx $28.00 (plus tax, $5) = $32.

Will be back to try their Crispy Egg Rolls and Curry Fish!

excerpts: Yellow curry fish, baby Thai coconuts and TEA SALAD!
Brilliant.
Try it out!!
curry fish.author: Lauren S.
curry fish.review:
Cheap, fast, home-cooking right in front of your eyes - always packed (which is a great thing) great location, and friendly, family-vibe service.

Yellow curry fish, baby Thai coconuts and TEA SALAD! Brilliant. Try it out!!

excerpts: The food: tea leaf salad, curry fish over rice, tofu and vegetables over rice.
curry fish.author: Tak N.
curry fish.review:
Summary: it's cheap hipster chow for folks who aspire to travel to exotic 3rd world locales (or who think that the Mission is). While very affordable--with an atmosphere reminiscent of a hawker centre in SEA--the food was nothing remarkable.

The food: tea leaf salad, curry fish over rice, tofu and vegetables over rice.

The tea leaf salad was tasty; the one thing that stood out. The other two dishes, while well-prepared, didn't really distinguish themselves flavor-wise from Chinese. It reminded me of upgraded college food-cart fare, if my alma mater was the Universidad de Hipsterdam.

Would I go again? Sure, it's cheap, tasty and quick.

excerpts: Because I had the curry fish last night and it was so good that i think the only way i can get it off of my mind is to process the pleasure here.
SO GOOD.

I usually get the Yamo House Noodles with Pork (its greasy garlic noodles with bacon, really), but decided to go for the fried curry fish instead because somehow i thought fried fish would be a healthy alternative to grilled pork.
curry fish.author: Tom T.
curry fish.review:
Everyone already knows Yamo is about the most badass eatery in the city, so why would I waste numb my fingers writing a review?  

Because I had the curry fish last night and it was so good that i think the only way i can get it off of my mind is to process the pleasure here.  SO GOOD.  I usually get the Yamo House Noodles with Pork (its greasy garlic noodles with bacon, really), but decided to go for the fried curry fish instead because somehow i thought fried fish would be a healthy alternative to grilled pork.  Whatever.  

So good.  The fish was stellar, fried but still softish, served with some veggies over noodles.  The curry was pretty hot and really tasty.  Blew my mind.

Oh!  And the ladies behind the counter were definitely the nicest they've ever been.

excerpts: Curry fish rice - rice was stale hard.
curry fish.author: Katy N.
curry fish.review:
Went there last night with a friend that said 'is really good', I beg the differ! The food was mediocre and boy was I circling for almost 30 mins to find parking - EPIC PAIN!

The extra star given cuz to my delight the 3 'MOMS' aka chefs were busting out Cantonese (when one would think 'Burmese' after all, this is a Burmese restaurant) talking smacks and mocking two customers on what they ordered - COMICAL!

What we ordered:
Tea salad - nothing special
Samosas - alright, dry and one of the samosa had a strong 'SOUR' smelling in the stuffing aka expired...yucky!
Cold chicken noodle - decent and chicken quite tender.
Curry fish rice - rice was stale hard. Could barely taste the curry and the fish was quite edible.

Not worth the parking hassle for me to ever return....just sayin'

excerpts: We tried the curry fish (fried fish pieces sauteed with veggies in curry sauce) and curry vegetables with noodles.
Both tasted great - noodles were a tad oily though, and don't be surprised if the "curry" dishes have no curry in them (like Thai curries).
I was concerned about the fish quality, but hey, I lived to write this review with no stomach upsets!
curry fish.author: Shweta V.
curry fish.review:
My new favorite hole in the wall...right here in the Mission! Where else can you get  2 big fresh summer rolls with shrimp for $3.50, dinner entrees for $5.25 (fish/shrimp/tofu...doesn't matter...they won't charge you a couple of extra $ for seafood!), and top it off with fresh coconut juice? Plus, the food is cooked right in front of you, so you know you aren't eating thawed stuff! 

We tried the curry fish (fried fish pieces sauteed with veggies in curry sauce) and curry vegetables with noodles. Both tasted great - noodles were a tad oily though, and don't be surprised if the "curry" dishes have no curry in them (like Thai curries). I was concerned about the fish quality, but hey, I lived to write this review with no stomach upsets! Also, loved that the veg curry had okra. 

The place is small - it's like a little food bar - you seat yourself based on available space, and sit facing the chefs. The ladies who run the place look like they enjoy what they are doing, and IMO, that makes the food better! They are friendly though - make eye contact & smile, and you'll be surprised. However, don't expect much conversation with them...it may look like a bar, but they sure are not chatty. The food rocks, is served fast, and they will not rush you to finish, even though the line outside is a half block long.

excerpts:
catfish chowder(spicy, brothy yum)
curry fish w/rice(yummy, yum,yum)
curry fish.author: Kia B.
curry fish.review:
I'm such a fan of this place.
It's like a  on-again-off-again lover you keep 
them on the DL for a bit. Sometimes you swear off
carbs, or cut back on extra fats,
But  you always come back for more.
They know exactly what you like and you're never disappointed.
It's a little messy sometimes, maybe even greasy but you always 
leave satiated. The saucy ladies that run the place, take their 
time to come to you  they yell at each other and maybe even 
at the customers. No harm intended, just the way it is, as if they 
are yelling at children in their living room. And that's exactly how it 
feels, like you are sitting in the living room at the house of your 
Burmese auntie waiting for a home cooked meal. 
My faves:
tea leaf salad(spicy sour/salty goodness)
catfish chowder(spicy, brothy yum)
curry fish w/rice(yummy, yum,yum)

I suggest calling ahead for pick up. This tiny place gets packed
and the wait can be upwards of 20 minutes. Any of the above items
are great for takeout. But while all of the curry noodle dishes
are great eaten in the restaurant, but sometimes they lack enough
sauce and can be on the dry side when ordered to go. . .

excerpts: I ordered "Curry fish with steam rice
"  Spicy.
Fish was fresh and melt in your mouth.
YAMOLICIOUS!!!
Get it?
curry fish.author: Leah E.
curry fish.review:
I would have never found this place in a gazillion years if not for Yelp!  Thanks, Yelpers!!!

(Now I am in big trouble after finding this place!! I go to meetings around the corner from Yamo few times a week.  It will be hard to skip the place.  I just have to remember to bring cash everytime.)



Date:  November 25, 2008 at 11:58 AM

Occasion: Lunchbreak. Food to go.

Venue: The place is cute:  like a grandma's kitchen in Asia kind of cute.
              The whole place is a kitchen with counter seatings for 9.
              Think Asian, rustic version of the Mario Batali Kitchen.
 
Decor: None. Rustic. Simple. Basic
             Stove, pots and pans
              One long counter seating.

Social Scene:  I was the only person at the place aside from the two old ladies cooking.  I had the best seat in the house and was very much entertained watching them cook.  One customer came in and picked up her phoned-in order.

Taste:  I ordered "Curry fish with steam rice"  Spicy. Fish was fresh and melt in your mouth. YAMOLICIOUS!!! Get it? ;)

Future Taste:  Tea Salad
                           Mango chicken
                           Everything on the menu which is a short-list.

Tab:  $5.25 ( no tax/no tip jar in sight)

Skip:  Dining at Yamo if you are claustrophobic like me.  This place is good for meals to go.  Otherwise, you will be eating elbow to elbow with the person right next to you.  

Downside:  Cash only.
                      You'll end up smelling of food while waiting for your order.
                      Forget about privacy. Save your racy stories for dessert somewhere else.

excerpts: Tea Leaf Salad. & Curry Fish w/ Noodles.
curry fish.author: Sara K.
curry fish.review:
Delicious.

Recommendations... Tea Leaf Salad. & Curry Fish w/ Noodles.

Ladies at the counter are great.

excerpts: Real cheap eats here,  I just tried the Curry Fish w/ Noodles.. they were pretty good half way through, then my taste buds gave out on me.
The taste got old pretty quick.
They were fast, the place has "hole in the wall" charm, maybe the other food is more tasty!?!?
The samosas and spring rolls looked great though,
curry fish.author: JASON L.
curry fish.review:
You ladies are alright in there. Real nice and informal.
Real cheap eats here,  I just tried the Curry Fish w/ Noodles.. they were pretty good half way through, then my taste buds gave out on me.  The taste got old pretty quick.
They were fast, the place has "hole in the wall" charm, maybe the other food is more tasty!?!? The samosas and spring rolls looked great though, Fry it up, cant go wrong.
About a block away theres a El Salvadorean restaurant that specializes in Papusas... i had a Pork and Queso .. YUMMEHHHH!!! $1.75each.

excerpts: Order: House Noodles with Chicken, Curry Tofu, Curry Fish, Curry Vegetables, Yamo Cold Noodles (with chicken or tofu), Mushroom Tofu, Chicken Noodle Soup.
curry fish.author: Crash O.
curry fish.review:
I love this place so much, words cannot even express. I don't even know what to say to the Yamo Haters, except, haters gotta hate. But I LOVE. 

Order: House Noodles with Chicken, Curry Tofu, Curry Fish, Curry Vegetables, Yamo Cold Noodles (with chicken or tofu), Mushroom Tofu, Chicken Noodle Soup.

Bonus for vegetarians and other tofu-lovers: They will sub tofu for meat in pretty much any dish, even if it's not listed as an option on the menu. The fact that the ladies who work here are all-business and brusque-verging-on-rude can be off-putting, but don't be fooled. These ladies really just want to serve you some delicious food cheaply and efficiently. 

FEEL THE LOVE.

excerpts: Try the tea leaf salad and curry fish w/ noodles.
Although some comments claim it is dirty, that is very misleading.
curry fish.author: Kimberly M.
curry fish.review:
When your in the mood for cheap and tasty with character....Yamo is the place to go. 

It is the ultimate hole in the wall and the food is great. Try the tea leaf salad and curry fish w/ noodles. Although some comments claim it is dirty, that is very misleading. I love the ambiance or the lack there of. 

You gotta try it!

excerpts: I love the black bean fish and the curry fish.
curry fish.author: Kelly Kate W.
curry fish.review:
cheap, greasy, and great. 

Love that they have fresh coconuts, although I always make a mess spooning out the fruit. 

Dishes may be a bit greasy, but all the veggies taste fresh and the food is fabulous overall. I love the black bean fish and the curry fish. 

Skip the appetizers.
